story:
No Licence No Registration No Worries!

Two riders power the FFAB, together or separately and have a handle bar each to steer and stop, uncomplicated as a bike, with some other useful bits bolted on in-between! It's a double-your-fun sociable transport device, ultralight and so conspicuously Green.

This fully functioning FFAB Speed-e model is based on Greek designer Basileios Marmarou's 1987 original, Gangsta Lean, a counter-balanced tilt steering concept with 12 speeds plus Reverse. We'd like to build many more but we've outgrown our West London premises to a point where we're now desperately searching for a bigger space at an affordable rent. 2013 prices have risen dramatically!

Why should you help us out with a pledged contribution or a reasonably rented workspace if you know of one? FFAB is a magical machine, it fits snugly into a gray area of the law because nobody quite knows how to classify it just yet, human powered mobility disburdens it from any road taxes.

Think of FFAB as more than just a weekend toy, it's a new basic platform on which to build one's brainstorms upon; add a windscreen, fashion a body with a convertible top if you're handy with your hands or link up a brushless electric motor with a Lithium pack for effortless hill climbing excursions!

If you find you now have an urge to dabble in the kinetics arts, imagine a different colour scheme for the FFAB you would personalise, consider yourself already In, you get it! Perhaps you have some creative upgrade ideas of your own that you're now ready to dust off, bolt on and test out.

Exhibited in February @ The Muse Gallery 269 Portobello Road, Notting Hill

Having spent the time, effort and money to get it right, we now need a helping hand to expand organically into a proper sized workspace with some elbow room so that nobody gets singed with a blowtorch. To guarantee low temp weld integrity and ultimately satisfy insurance underwriters, the best solution is the Techno Weld system but that means hiring in and training new staff, not a good fit in our present clutter zone. We also need room for multiple tube benders in the very near future.

A limited production run of 300 factory-finish Kits in a mix of oak, pine, molybdenum and aircraft grade aluminium is slated for this September with a base price of £2700, UK crafted framework, Kevlar safe cockpit, 22° lateral tolerance steering plus 9 speeds and flip lever reverse as standard.

Naturally, the cost of building a FFAB Speed-e can only be slashed this low when we buy higher quantities of components and have an easily accessible place to store them in pre-assembly. The parts list has already been pared down by throwing out FFAB's pedals and chains in preference for direct stroke push paddle motivation, which adds double the efficiency of Jackshaft transmissions.

There's just one thing left to do and FFAB is ready for the roll-out, we must prove it's ruggedness and reliability and you can be more than a mere spectator by sharing this Indiegogo project with your friends. Publicity is what generates orders but we don't expect you to do the marketing work for us, no no no! We've planned the toughest road test ever imagined, London to Gibraltar by foot propulsion, 4 relay pilots on 4 wheels. Follow us on Youtube! Like our Facebook page, if you Like!

A million Thanks to one and all for supporting FFAB Design and for your kind contributions!

story:
THE MILLENNIAL TRAINS PROJECT (MTP) is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization that leads crowd-funded transcontinental train journeys for diverse groups of young innovators (and virtual audiences) to explore America's new frontiers.

To get on board, applicants design a project to advance across the communities where our train stops and then race to be among the first 15 applicants on their selected train journey to reach their $5,000 crowdfunding goal. To learn more about the 2016 journeys click here. The applicant's project is described below.

Hello there. My name is Carl Stanton, and I am a designer, thinker, maker, train guru, Quaker, and knowledge collector.  With your help I am planning on participating in the 2016 Millennial trains project.  I am excited to participate because I will have the opportunity to spend time with a diverse group of people from all over the country, and 
What if you could take a road trip..... by train??
The inter-City Auto Train would allow you to do exactly that.

The Inter-City Auto Train is a new travel experience the combines the freedom and flexibility of driving with the comfort and efficiency of riding the train. At Designated station along existing Amtrak routes passengers would be able to get one or off the train with their car.  

 Since 1971 The Auto Train has been the only train in the United States where you could take your car with you.. Running from Suburban DC to Suburban Orlando, over 250,000 people have ridden this service, and it is Amtrak most financially successful long-distance train. 

The Inter-City Auto Train would expand this service to 10 Amtrak routes covering virtually every part of the United States. 

 The Inter-City Auto Train would enable a new form of travel where people could drive some parts and ride the train for others. For example, I could take a train with my car from Chicago to Albuquerque, NM (As I will on the Millenial Trains Project), then drive from Albuquerque to the Grand Canyon, than drive from the Grand Canyon to Denver, CO, and then get on the train to go back to Chicago. Riding the train for those sections would turn what would ordinarily be long and pretty boring drives into a relaxing ride with comfortable seating, a lounge car to take in the incredible scenery, and access to food.  

 While am waiting from the Inter-City Auto Train at the station, I could relax in the lounge, grab a nice meal, or play some games while I am waiting. 

During the Millennial Trains Project I will be presented my completed vision of the Inter-City Auto Train at each city along the trip.  I hope to solicit feedback, gain publicity, and build support for this project through that process. 

How will you use your time in each city to advance your project?

 I will use my time in each city to advance my project in several ways. I hope to meet with local developers, city planners, and public officials to gain feedback and build support for my Inter-City Auto Train service proposal. I will also work on compiling a list of attractions and places of interest within 200 miles of the train station. I also hope to take detailed photographs and measurements of areas around the station to accurately map out possible station re-designs.  

What is your MTP project designed to accomplish?

What my project is designed to accomplish is to build contacts and collect information and feedback about people’s interest in and desire for Inter-City Auto Train Service. I also hope to document and plan possible station sties. I am hoping to build local partnerships with people and business interested in bringing this service to the cities. At the end of the project I plan to have enough information to create a business plan for this service on the route traveled during the project.  

How does your project differ from other projects in your sphere?

Auto Trains have existed in some form for over 50 years. They have ranged in form from the shuttle trains that run through the Channel Tunnel, where passengers drive their cars directly onto the train and stay with their vehicle, to the Style of the Current Amtrak Auto Train, where large numbers of cars are loaded onto Autoracks and passengers ride into regular rail cars. No other project I have found in my research does what mine does, created a multiple-stop long distance Auto Train service. This project is also unique because it transforms train stations into setups closer to modern airports. The new Inter-city Auto train stations have lounge spaces, recreation areas, food options, and other activities for travelers while they are waiting for their train. Most other passenger train projects focus on the stations more as places integrated with other destinations as opposed to destinations themselves. 

What do you plan to create as a result of your MTP journey, and by when?

After the MTP journey is over I plan to create a detailed as possible service and business plan for Inter-City Auto Train Service on the route travelled by the MTP journey. This plan will include service frequency, ticket costs, and designated loading/unloading stops, as well as ideas for station redesigned to accommodate this new service. In addition I will use information collected on this trip to include estimated implementation costs of the system, particularly station re-designs. I will complete this task no later than October 15th 2016.  

How will you share the impact of your project and MTP experience with others?

Before the MTP begins I will have a website about my inter-city auto train project, and I will be updating this website during the trip. I will have also created promotional materials including videos as part of my school project. I also plan on using what I learn and gather during the journey to create additional promotional materials. After the completion of the MTP I hope to use what I have learned long with the rest of the work I have completed my project to present my service to Amtrak.

story:
What is Cosplace? Cosplace is the first mobile photo sharing app made just for the cosplay community.

What are you raising money for? We're raising money to upgrade our current version for iPhone, and to build our much-requested Android version of Cosplace.

Above picture: Designs for the next Cosplace for iPhone and Android.

What have you done so far? We released Cosplace 1.0 for iPhone in January, and an update earlier this Spring. You can get our iPhone version for free right now!

Cosplace 1.1 for iPhone is now available for free on the app store

Is Cosplace like Instagram? It does have similar characteristics. But Cosplace is currently in beta and does not have some of the bells ad whistles you might be used to on Instagram. What we do have is the first app just for cosplay, and with your help we can make it a lot better.

Do a lot of people use Cosplace right now? We currently have several hundred users and regular daily activity. They've provided some amazing feedback and we're ready to build the next version. People are definitely excited.

What about Yaya Han? Yes, she likes us! She let us create some custom mockups too!


What can you do in Cosplace? Share photos of your cosplays at conventions, in the studio. You can even share your works in progress. We have our own Workshop category! Hooray process! You can also like and comment on other posts as well.

How much do you need? We're raising $25,000, which will cover the next MVPs for iPhone and Android.

What the heck is an MVP? An MVP in the app development world stands for Minimum Viable Product. It's how Instagram started, and pretty much every app on your phone. MVP one is the most basic version, and then it keeps improving with a each new version (MVP). While apps eventually stop becoming MVPs, they are never finished. They evolve and improve over time. After all, Instagram is five years old. Do you remember it back in 2010? We do. It was pretty basic back then, too. 

UH I don't get it why can't it be perfect immediately? Well, perfection is expensive. But think about it another way: was your first costume perfect? Probably not. It was really basic and had some issues but each costume go better and better until it reached breath taking level, right? Well, same goes for apps. We'll get to breath taking level wit your help.

Didn't I JUST see you on that other crowdfunding site? Yes, we launched a Kickstarter and quickly realized we made a few mistakes and decided to reboot quickly. We've cancelled that project and moved to Indiegogo with a more manageable goal, and a flexible funding model so we'll get to keep what we raise.

If you don't reach your goal, is Cosplace dead like Jon Snow? Jon Snow is not dead, and nor will Cosplace be. The app has been self-funded by our founder so far, and he will continue to do so. We can just go faster with your help.

Awesome! Can I see more of Cosplace now? Yes, see the gallery below of mockups for the next version, and if you're on an iPhone, you can download Cosplace 1.1 now for free.

Got more questions? Ask us on Twitter or on our Facebook Page. Tag them with #Cosplace!

New reward added: A 5x7 glossy photo postcard featuring our favorite photo from our community.

The TEAM

SEAMUS CONDRON, FOUNDER
Seamus is the founder and CEO Fandom Labs, makers of Cosplace. He's really just a quiet, sometimes humorous, sometimes sarcastic, aging geek who has a lot of crazy ideas, and finally decided to pursue one. He's worked for media and tech companies in the NYC area for the last ten years, with roles focusing largely on building communities around content, whether through social media, content marketing, or other medium. He loves to be hands-on in whatever he does, and most of his professional roles have had considerable autonomy, which helped him to become a serial self-learner. That comes in handy when you decide to start a company by yourself

ROBIN BAKER, PROJECT MANAGER
Robin is a costumer, toy smith, doctoral student, adventurer, consumer of fantasy and graphic novels, and homeschooling mom. She lives in Portland with her daughter AJ and her partner Phil. Three years ago the family discovered comic cons and the world of cosplay. They haven't looked back since. In between comic cons, Robin spends much of her time time researching mental health policy by day and crafting costumes for her daughter by night.

JASON REYNOLDS, TECHNICAL ADVISOR
Jason graduated with a degree in philosophy prior to discovering his passion for software engineering. He currently runs the engineering team at a New York venture capital firm. His previous roles include building social media publishing tools, payment processing products and high frequency trading systems. He also enjoys mentoring young engineers via iMentor and Thinkful and bringing together passionate technologists at meetups.

story:
The Battle for Fort Washington

Last summer was the debut of our Battle for Fort Washington road cycling training race and clinic series, just outside Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Each of the three nights over 75 riders came out, a quarter of them beginners and another quarter women. It was one of the most fun competitive cycling events in the region, and has great promise going forward to keep recruiting and developing new racers from all ages and genders.

This year we're making it free. The QCW Cycling club has already committed to covering the fixed costs---EMTs, officials, permits, etc.---and ensuring this event happens not just this year, but next year as well. World class coaches from Breakaway Bikes are once again volunteering to lead the coached riding, clinics, and skills drills. We also expect the Pennsylvania Cycling Association to support the event again this year. But we need to defray the per-rider insurance costs, and to do that we're calling on you and the whole community to make it happen.

The series itself is coming up fast now, Wednesday evenings on July 8, 15, and 22nd. Full details are available from the First States Cycling Association website, and updates go to the First States Facebook page. We'll see you there!

Costs

Compared to many events, this series is inexpensive to run. Fort Washington State Park charges comparatively very small and completely reasonable fees to occupy the entire park each evening. Our other big fixed cost is professional EMTs, which we think are important to have on site for any competitive cycling event. Those and our other fixed costs are all covered.

But, each participant costs about $4 per night. Almost all of that ($3.60) goes to USA Cycling for necessary event insurance. Then there's minor costs for race numbers and waivers. Last year we had a nominal $5 registration fee to cover that.

Just Ride

This year we're not going to run any registration, for a couple reasons. One is simply that for such a low fee, it's unfortunate to incur the hassle of requiring all the participants to register online (we can't take registration money in the park). A substantial portion of the fees also then just go straight to the registrar website. Working registration is also the most stressful role for the volunteers running the event, trying to process everybody as quickly as possible in the tight interval between riders arriving from work and the event starting. Without registration fees, racers can just roll up, flash a license, and then jump into the event.

Beyond that, registration fees are just another barrier. All our participants need to have a USA Cycling license to meet insurance requirements. That costs $15 for a day, or $70 for the year. A totally new racer who just wants to give it a try one night is looking at a $20 event. If we can eliminate the $5 registration, then we've chopped off a quarter of that and made it even more likely for them to come.


What We Need

That said, we still need to cover the per-rider costs. In the long run it's not sustainable to keep putting those solely on our primary supporting organizations. So we're running this campaign to have the entire community contribute, from other organizations and clubs down to individuals.

For the racers already planning on coming out to the series, we hope you'll join in making it happen. If you can pitch in more than your costs, you'll be helping to bring in other riders still unsure about racing or more constrained.

For everybody else, we hope you will also support the series. It benefits all of us to have an organized, safe, fun event like this exposing new riders to competitive cycling, and creating a great space for women and men to race together. Even if you're not yourself interested in racing or you simply can't make it to these events yourself, it helps everybody to have clinics and educational efforts like this creating stronger, safer, better cyclists.

The Impact

This series is a great event, and its debut last year universally hailed as fantastically successful and a wonderful development for competitive cycling in the region.

By joining us in making it happen, you're enabling:

  • Education-oriented, fun racing, providing an accessible first race for newcomers, a safe space for women and men to race together, and a fun training race for veterans:
    • Three fields each night to cover all rider levels, including a women's-specific field;
    • Coached components to start off the beginners' fields, teaching proper group riding and cornering;
    • A no-drop approach: Racers that fall behind get put back into the race to give it another try and learn more.
  • Professionally run clinics and skills drills:
    • Short discussions on training, safe riding, and race tactics.
    • Exercises teaching cornering, bump recovery, and other critical skills.
  • A fantastic summer cycling community event.

If we can keep this series growing while we also developing it into a sustainable, perpetual event, it'll be a big deal for cycling in this region. Help make that happen.

If this campaign exceeds the per-rider costs incurred, the extra funds will be put toward purchasing licenses for new junior racers coming out, and supporting our other events this year and next, including the Arsenal Crit and Philly Phlyer.

Risks & Challenges

There is no risk of the series not happening. QCW Cycling, the PCA, Breakaway Bikes, and all our volunteers are committed to making it happen. This crowdfunding campaign is instead a first step toward developing both the community and the financial model to ensure it always happens.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't or prefer not to contribute to this campaign, that's totally fine. We hope you will still come out and join us for all the events!

Beyond that, we can really use everyone's help spreading the word about both the event itself and this campaign. Since we're not requiring registration, we won't appear on a number of calendars riders use to find events. Help us make sure everyone hears about it! Please post and share any and all of:

  • The Battle for Fort Washington website
  • The First States Cycling Association's Facebook page
  • This campaign page

We will also be looking for just a few volunteers each evening to help things run smoothly and safely. Stay tuned on our Facebook page, and we'll see you out there!
story_txt:
The Battle for Fort Washington
Last summer was the debut of our Battle for Fort Washington road cycling training race and clinic series, just outside Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Each of the three nights over 75 riders came out, a quarter of them beginners and another quarter women. It was one of the most fun competitive cycling events in the region, and has great promise going forward to keep recruiting and developing new racers from all ages and genders.


This year we're making it free. The QCW Cycling club has already committed to covering the fixed costs---EMTs, officials, permits, etc.---and ensuring this event happens not just this year, but next year as well. World class coaches from Breakaway Bikes are once again volunteering to lead the coached riding, clinics, and skills drills. We also expect the Pennsylvania Cycling Association to support the event again this year. But we need to defray the per-rider insurance costs, and to do that we're calling on you and the whole community to make it happen.

The series itself is coming up fast now, Wednesday evenings on July 8, 15, and 22nd. Full details are available from the First States Cycling Association website, and updates go to the First States Facebook page. We'll see you there!


Costs
Compared to many events, this series is inexpensive to run. Fort Washington State Park charges comparatively very small and completely reasonable fees to occupy the entire park each evening. Our other big fixed cost is professional EMTs, which we think are important to have on site for any competitive cycling event. Those and our other fixed costs are all covered.

But, each participant costs about $4 per night. Almost all of that ($3.60) goes to USA Cycling for necessary event insurance. Then there's minor costs for race numbers and waivers. Last year we had a nominal $5 registration fee to cover that.
   Just Ride
This year we're not going to run any registration, for a couple reasons. One is simply that for such a low fee, it's unfortunate to incur the hassle of requiring all the participants to register online (we can't take registration money in the park). A substantial portion of the fees also then just go straight to the registrar website. Working registration is also the most stressful role for the volunteers running the event, trying to process everybody as quickly as possible in the tight interval between riders arriving from work and the event starting. Without registration fees, racers can just roll up, flash a license, and then jump into the event.

Beyond that, registration fees are just another barrier. All our participants need to have a USA Cycling license to meet insurance requirements. That costs $15 for a day, or $70 for the year. A totally new racer who just wants to give it a try one night is looking at a $20 event. If we can eliminate the $5 registration, then we've chopped off a quarter of that and made it even more likely for them to come.




What We Need
That said, we still need to cover the per-rider costs. In the long run it's not sustainable to keep putting those solely on our primary supporting organizations. So we're running this campaign to have the entire community contribute, from other organizations and clubs down to individuals.

For the racers already planning on coming out to the series, we hope you'll join in making it happen. If you can pitch in more than your costs, you'll be helping to bring in other riders still unsure about racing or more constrained.

For everybody else, we hope you will also support the series. It benefits all of us to have an organized, safe, fun event like this exposing new riders to competitive cycling, and creating a great space for women and men to race together. Even if you're not yourself interested in racing or you simply can't make it to these events yourself, it helps everybody to have clinics and educational efforts like this creating stronger, safer, better cyclists.

 This series is a great event, and its debut last year universally hailed as fantastically successful and a wonderful development for competitive cycling in the region.
By joining us in making it happen, you're enabling:


Education-oriented, fun racing, providing an accessible first race for newcomers, a safe space for women and men to race together, and a fun training race for veterans:
Three fields each night to cover all rider levels, including a women's-specific field;
Coached components to start off the beginners' fields, teaching proper group riding and cornering;
A no-drop approach: Racers that fall behind get put back into the race to give it another try and learn more.


Professionally run clinics and skills drills:
Short discussions on training, safe riding, and race tactics.
Exercises teaching cornering, bump recovery, and other critical skills.


A fantastic summer cycling community event.

If we can keep this series growing while we also developing it into a sustainable, perpetual event, it'll be a big deal for cycling in this region. Help make that happen.
If this campaign exceeds the per-rider costs incurred, the extra funds will be put toward purchasing licenses for new junior racers coming out, and supporting our other events this year and next, including the Arsenal Crit and Philly Phlyer.


    Risks & Challenges There is no risk of the series not happening. QCW Cycling, the PCA, Breakaway Bikes, and all our volunteers are committed to making it happen. This crowdfunding campaign is instead a first step toward developing both the community and the financial model to ensure it always happens.
    Other Ways You Can Help If you can't or prefer not to contribute to this campaign, that's totally fine. We hope you will still come out and join us for all the events!
Beyond that, we can really use everyone's help spreading the word about both the event itself and this campaign. Since we're not requiring registration, we won't appear on a number of calendars riders use to find events. Help us make sure everyone hears about it! Please post and share any and all of:



The Battle for Fort Washington website


The First States Cycling Association's Facebook page


This campaign page


We will also be looking for just a few volunteers each evening to help things run smoothly and safely. Stay tuned on our Facebook page, and we'll see you out there!

story:
Ever tried an e-scooter? It‘s silent, super agile and - it‘s fun!

We want to give e-mobility a huge boost by providing awesome electric scooters for everyone.

 

Here's what makes us special:

 

Our Vision

We want to make electric mobility accessible for everyone – with high performance electric scooters that anyone can afford. Like this we want to start a movement and remind people of their power to chose what is best for them.

 

1 Euro a Day

We want that everyone can afford a cool, fun and worthwhile means of transportation. Therefore we want to offer installments from 30 € a month, that is 1 € a day. Just like buying a new mobile phone.

Please check our FAQ for more detailed information.

 

 

 
 
 

 

A Solution that is Fun!

A platform that makes awesome e-scooters affordable for everyone is the perfect way to combine the protection of this awesome planet with fun and lifestyle. The problems caused by traffic like lack of space, congestion, parking issues, stressful noise, harmful air pollution and greenhouse gas emissions – electric scooters can contribute so much to solving all of these problems. Let's make this happen.

 

 

 

 

Strong and simple: SCOOTERRA ONE

 

The scooter comes with three different power modi:

  • 25 km/h panorama mode
  • city mode
  • full 3 kW motor power mode for steep routes

 

Modular

We do not want to build throwaway products. It is therefore an essential part of our philosophy to make the modularity of the scooters accessible for you. This means that when, for example, different battery technology becomes available, you will be able to integrate it into your scooter and modernize it. This way you can stay up to date.

Open Source

By using open source components we ensure that our e-scooters are easy to repair and spare parts are available and cheap. We make it simple.

The Importance of Modularity and Open Source Standards

We want to make everything as easy and accessible as possible. This ensures that the e-scooters are easy to repair and to update and therefore contribute a great deal to the convenience of the customer.

This is already awesome but sincerely we are aiming further than this: the accessible modularity of the e-scooters make this project more sustainable because the vehicle does NOT become useless as soon as there is new technology available or a part is broken etc..

 

 

 

 

 

 
 
 

A Business made to go with Time

We want to build a company that is able to respond to changes, whether in terms of technical possibilities or the needs of the drivers. It's important to build flexible businesses – after all, the lack of flexibility of companies is something that put us in this precarious situation that we and/ or our offspring will find ourselves in. We want to always strive for the best solution and never hold on to something that does not comply with the current opportunities regarding sustainability. Part of this philosophy is aiming at different solutions for the body of the e-scooters. We want to offer bodies that are made from ecological materials asap, for example using biodegradable plastics in 3D printing. Those bodies again shall fit the current frame. This is how modularity and open standards can contribute to customer convenience and sustainability at the same time. We are really looking forward to savoring the possibilities and hope that we get as much support as possible and as soon as possible in order to get involved in this area and re-deal the cards. The linchpin of the power to change the market are the sales figures and the support we get.

 


 

All you need in one Shop

We want to build an online shop that provides everything you'd want to assemble your own individual e-scooter: various scooter models, spare parts, accessories, different colored bodies, lamps, shock absorbers, motors, batteries, helmet cases and so on. Because of the accessible modularity of our e-scooters many configurations become possible.

 
 

 

 

The E-Scooter Community - let's get together

Through our community you will be able to get inspired and be inspiring for a new kind of mobility. Find instructional DIY videos on repairing and exchange know-how of configurating your e-scooter.

 

The SCOOTERRA Manifesto

We believe in change.

We have the power to create choices. For us that’s the point of being human. We can abstract, we can imagine, we can create and we can change.
In nowadays cities many of us are struggling with space issues, a shortage of parking places, with stressful noise and sickening pollution. We want to remind the people of their power to make decisions and transform our cities and environments. We have many different opportunities to do so. Bringing electric mobility to the people is one them. Electric scooters are a fast and easy way to push electric mobility. One who has experienced the pleasure of electric driving won’t go back so easily. It’s fun, it’s silent, it doesn’t stink, it feels lightweight and the acceleration is awesome.
We believe in this change.

Our vision: A world in which modular electric scooters are daily routine.

On our platform people can find new ways of mobility and share their e-scooter stories. They can charge their scooters with solar power during office time and listen to music at the lake in the evening under soft and warm fairy lights – all powered by their e-scooters. Everyone can spot their scooter from far away because they all look different. At the same time, many parts are interchangeable.
The cities are quiet, there is just the soft buzzing of agile electric scooters, the sound of people walking on firm asphalt, talking to each other and some music from the inside of a café nearby. People leave their homes to enjoy their environment. Weather apps let them be prepared for the upcoming weather. They sit in cafes eating cake from the money they saved from not having to buy gasoline. Many of those people would have taken the car if there hadn't been this opportunity. Now they wouldn't want to swap this feeling of fresh air and smoothness against the never ending search for parking space, traffic jams and petrol bills. Cars are mostly registered in winter now and are parked at parking lots at the city boundaries. In the city centre, where there used to be cars all over the place, there are now parks and people sitting in the sun, comfortably reclaiming their space to live.

 

Our Story

Growing up at the Baltic Sea near Rostock, Jasper – the founder of SCOOTERRA – now lives with his family in Marburg, a small town in the middle of Germany. There, him and his daughter got asthma. The number of respiratory diseases in Germany is vastly increasing, because efforts to enforce renewable energies and electric mobility are being repeatedly slowed down from several directions.

With SCOOTERRA, Jasper has developed a concept that can provide cities with an easy and quick solution to problems of air pollution, congestion, parking shortage and noise. He is convinced that this is a most effective way to improve the lives of individuals and maintain our environment.

 

The Team

Behind this project we stand, three friends from quite different directions. We share the courage to think big ideas and the enthusiasm to learn to realize them. And we really love to drive electric scooters.

 

Jasper Häger has always been passionate about technology. From a very young age, he had the opportunity to work on mopeds and cars. In the rural area where he grew up he was able to test them quite early. In the 1990s, he followed the beginnings of renewable energy, and since then, he has been constantly learning about the latest opportunities and policy developments in this field. It was the same with electric mobility. SCOOTERRA is the means by which he wants to concentrate all his knowledge and create a movement that can change the lives of many people.

 

 

Benita Hahn is an artist with a passion for conceptional work on rooms and spaces. In this mission she sees the opportunity to realize a concept of space in close relation to urgent questions of our time. She also strives to optimize the structure of processes and communication within the company.

 
 
 
 
 
 

Eva Kottkamp studied Sociology and is currently studying Sustainable Development. She is passionate about transformation processes regarding individuals as well as societies. She is confident that these times can bring interesting changes and is an advocate for playing an active part in one's own life.

 
 

Our Team Support

Dominik Hofmann from "Gründung-Hessen" supports us in setting up our company. He helps us in the development of our corporate concept, in networking, is the point of contact in financing matters and takes over the bookkeeping.

Marco Kehring is an IT professional and likes to drive to work with his different motorcycles. He loves acceleration and this is why he was so fond of the e-scooter right away. He works with Jasper on all the programming of the controllers and is exploring the possibilities of these vehicles.

Yacine Hadj Aissa helps us with his good soul, big heart and his skills in SEO.

Sandrine Zeuner-Guerrier is supporting us with translation and correspondence.

Marlene Rehs assists our team in coordinating public relations and press releases.

 

Funding

The money will be used to start the production of the SCOOTERRA ONE modell. We will check every single scooter and deliver it right to your home. We will expand our team and involve our partners in areas of accountancy, insurance, marketing and press.

We chose a flexible funding because our project is scalable depending on our raised funds.

 

 

 

FAQ

What's the current status of your project?

We have worked in close contact with our producer in China to create this awesome e-scooter. We have everything set to ship your SCOOTERRA ONE to your location in spring next year. Now we need you to make this happen.

Why e-scooters?

E-scooters can change your everyday life and improve our cities!

They are a solution for the space and environmental problems that we are struggling with in our cities. Beside the great options of different e-bikes, we think that people need e-scooters to have an option, where it is possible to ride together on one vehicle and enjoy the acceleration of the electric engine. This is brisk and smooth driving at the same time. We just love it.

The price is very low for an e-scooter with such a powerful motor and long reach. Why is that?

It is a crucial part of our mission to make e-mobility accessible and attractive for everyone. This meant we had to combine cheap price with great performance. To achieve this we use only parts that already exist on the market while making sure to use the best possible option for every part. We use open standard components which ensure a reliable and cheap supply of spare parts. Because we want e-mobility to be simple, cool and fun.

How can I get the offer of 1 Euro a day?

It is essential for us that everyone can afford fun electric mobility!

In our future shop the option of paying by installments will be integrated in the order transaction. Different rates will be possible including the option of 30 Euro per month which is 1 Euro a day.

To make use of the financing option choose one of our perks for reservation of a SCOOTERRA ONE in the campaign. Within the next 4 weeks after the end of the campaign you will be forwarded an e-mail with information on the next steps towards the best financing option for you.In cooperation with SMAVA, we can already offer this financing option in Germany. We are working on realizing this option in other countries, too.

Are there any subsidies for purchasing an e-scooter?

Yes, there are a lot! Be sure to look up all the awesome offers from cities and countries who subsidise the purchase of an electric vehicle. The subsidies range between 150 and 1500 EUR for an electric scooter so it's definitely worth to check it out. On our homepage you can already find links to many of these programs, most of them in Germany. We are working on expanding this list of subsidy programs in different countries. We also want to encourage you to send us links with information on subsidies we can add to our list.

What's the Early Bird membership that you mention in your perks?

Every backer who preorders a SCOOTERRA ONE in this campaign will get an Early Bird membership. You are making this happen. We will be happy to offer you little gifts from time to time in our future shop. Be prepared.

Do you ship outside of Europe?

We will be able to deliver to locations outside of Europe as soon as there is the miminum amount of 30 orders per country. If at the end of the campaign there are less then 30 orders placed from your country (outside of Europe), you can choose to either get 70% percent of your contribution back or let us use your contribution for the realisation of the project. To minimize your risk, we advice people from countries outside of Europe to preorder SCOOTERRA ONE by doing an advance payment of 100 EUR via the campaign (instead of higher payments or full price).

Can SCOOTERRA ONE go faster than 45km/h?

Yes. In Europe we have a speed limit of 45km/h for this kind of scooter but we can program SCOOTERRA ONE to go faster and adjust it to the speed for the regulations in Canada, the US or elsewhere.

Are the costs for delivery included?

For Germany, yes. If you live outside from Germany you are responsible for taxes and additional transportation costs to your location. The more vehicles will be ordered to your country, the lower the transportation costs will be. Currently we estimate the delivery costs to be between 100 and 200 EUR for Europe. We can also ship to other countries and also to different continents in case there is a minimum amount of 30 orders made. We ship Canada and the US directly from our production site in China to keep the tax and transportation cost as low as possible.

Do you do refunds?

In case that we are not able to deliver your SCOOTERRA ONE to your location due to any legal restrictions on the import or delivery of your e-scooter, we shall refund you 70% of the amount of your contribution. Please make sure whether it is legal to import, deliver, and operate SCOOTERRA ONE in your country in advance.

Does SCOOTERRA ONE come in different colors?

Yes. Principally every color and pattern is possible, even customization. How many colors we will be able to offer you to choose from, depends on how much support we get now. If you have a special request, let us know and we will see what we can do. :)

Will specifications change after the campaign?

We are still optimizing SCOOTERRA ONE to create the best electric scooter that you can find. Some parts might be replaced by more suitable and better options in order to meet this goal. Transparency with our features is very important to us because we know that this is essential for every customer.

Is it really true I can get up to 100 km on a single charge?

Yes. On average, you can reach 100km with a single charge. The reach however strongly depends on the driving style, weight and degree of the roads you usually take.

Do I need a license to drive SCOOTERRA ONE?

Yes you do. The scooters are 45 km/h fast. In Europe you need a type AM drivers license for scooters or a type B for cars. (Type B includes type AM) Check your countries provisions to find out, what kind of drivers license you need to ride a scooter.

Who is responsible for any additional taxes, duties or VAT/GST?

If you live in an European country the taxes are already included in the price. If you live outside of the European Union you are responsible for additional taxes. Please check the different regulation for your country.

How long is the life cycle of your batteries?

After 1000 times charging, which is approximately 100.000km, the capacity still is at 90%.

How long is the battery charging time?

It takes about 2-3 hours to charge one battery. A 10 Ah charger is included into the price.

What kind of accessories do you currently have or can I expect in the near future?

We plan to open our online shop in spring 2019. We will offer all spare parts for the scooters. Bit by bit we will also offer several accessories with which you can modify your individual scooter. This will include different seats, mirrors, shock absorbers, luggage racks etc..

Where can I repair the scooters?

Our e-scooters have a simple construction and we use standardized parts. Because of this, it will be easy for you to get cheap spare parts and you can adress every workshop. We will start listing the workshops that have experience with our e-scooters. Currently, we are setting up a network of workshops who have experience with electric scooters. As many parts will be easy to replace and repair, we want to do DIY tutorials.

Can I order multiple scooters for my company?

Yes you can. Please contact us via crowd@scooterra.eu

I live in Germany. Can I pick it up myself?

Yes you can. Please contact us via crowd@scooterra.eu with the subject „PICKUP“

How to contact SCOOTERRA?

Contact us via mail: crowd@scooterra.eu or find us at www.scooterra.eu.

Do you offer a guarantee? What‘s your warranty?

There's a two years warranty on SCOOTERRA ONE. We will offer all necessary spare parts in order to repair the vehicle if needed. It is not possible for us to provide a guarantee for SCOOTERRA ONE at this early stage of our company.

What is your returns-policy?

Within 14 days after the arrival of your ordered scooter you can return it without any explanation of reasons. For the transport costs you have to pay yourself.

She also strives to optimize the structure of processes and communication within the company.

 
 
 
 
 
 

Eva Kottkamp studied Sociology and is currently studying Sustainable Development. She is passionate about transformation processes regarding individuals as well as societies. She is confident that these times can bring interesting changes and is an advocate for playing an active part in one's own life.

 
 
Our Team SupportDominik Hofmann from "Gründung-Hessen" supports us in setting up our company. He helps us in the development of our corporate concept, in networking, is the point of contact in financing matters and takes over the bookkeeping.Marco Kehring is an IT professional and likes to drive to work with his different motorcycles. He loves acceleration and this is why he was so fond of the e-scooter right away. He works with Jasper on all the programming of the controllers and is exploring the possibilities of these vehicles.Yacine Hadj Aissa helps us with his good soul, big heart and his skills in SEO.Sandrine Zeuner-Guerrier is supporting us with translation and correspondence.Marlene Rehs assists our team in coordinating public relations and press releases. FundingThe money will be used to start the production of the SCOOTERRA ONE modell. We will check every single scooter and deliver it right to your home. We will expand our team and involve our partners in areas of accountancy, insurance, marketing and press.We chose a flexible funding because our project is scalable depending on our raised funds.   FAQ What's the current status of your project? We have worked in close contact with our producer in China to create this awesome e-scooter. We have everything set to ship your SCOOTERRA ONE to your location in spring next year. Now we need you to make this happen. Why e-scooters? E-scooters can change your everyday life and improve our cities!
They are a solution for the space and environmental problems that we are struggling with in our cities. Beside the great options of different e-bikes, we think that people need e-scooters to have an option, where it is possible to ride together on one vehicle and enjoy the acceleration of the electric engine. This is brisk and smooth driving at the same time. We just love it. The price is very low for an e-scooter with such a powerful motor and long reach. Why is that? It is a crucial part of our mission to make e-mobility accessible and attractive for everyone. This meant we had to combine cheap price with great performance. To achieve this we use only parts that already exist on the market while making sure to use the best possible option for every part. We use open standard components which ensure a reliable and cheap supply of spare parts. Because we want e-mobility to be simple, cool and fun. How can I get the offer of 1 Euro a day? It is essential for us that everyone can afford fun electric mobility!
In our future shop the option of paying by installments will be integrated in the order transaction. Different rates will be possible including the option of 30 Euro per month which is 1 Euro a day.
To make use of the financing option choose one of our perks for reservation of a SCOOTERRA ONE in the campaign. Within the next 4 weeks after the end of the campaign you will be forwarded an e-mail with information on the next steps towards the best financing option for you.In cooperation with SMAVA, we can already offer this financing option in Germany. We are working on realizing this option in other countries, too. Are there any subsidies for purchasing an e-scooter? Yes, there are a lot! Be sure to look up all the awesome offers from cities and countries who subsidise the purchase of an electric vehicle. The subsidies range between 150 and 1500 EUR for an electric scooter so it's definitely worth to check it out. On our homepage you can already find links to many of these programs, most of them in Germany. We are working on expanding this list of subsidy programs in different countries. We also want to encourage you to send us links with information on subsidies we can add to our list. What's the Early Bird membership that you mention in your perks?Every backer who preorders a SCOOTERRA ONE in this campaign will get an Early Bird membership. You are making this happen. We will be happy to offer you little gifts from time to time in our future shop. Be prepared. Do you ship outside of Europe? We will be able to deliver to locations outside of Europe as soon as there is the miminum amount of 30 orders per country. If at the end of the campaign there are less then 30 orders placed from your country (outside of Europe), you can choose to either get 70% percent of your contribution back or let us use your contribution for the realisation of the project. To minimize your risk, we advice people from countries outside of Europe to preorder SCOOTERRA ONE by doing an advance payment of 100 EUR via the campaign (instead of higher payments or full price). Can SCOOTERRA ONE go faster than 45km/h? Yes. In Europe we have a speed limit of 45km/h for this kind of scooter but we can program SCOOTERRA ONE to go faster and adjust it to the speed for the regulations in Canada, the US or elsewhere. Are the costs for delivery included? For Germany, yes. If you live outside from Germany you are responsible for taxes and additional transportation costs to your location. The more vehicles will be ordered to your country, the lower the transportation costs will be. Currently we estimate the delivery costs to be between 100 and 200 EUR for Europe. We can also ship to other countries and also to different continents in case there is a minimum amount of 30 orders made. We ship Canada and the US directly from our production site in China to keep the tax and transportation cost as low as possible. Do you do refunds? In case that we are not able to deliver your SCOOTERRA ONE to your location due to any legal restrictions on the import or delivery of your e-scooter, we shall refund you 70% of the amount of your contribution. Please make sure whether it is legal to import, deliver, and operate SCOOTERRA ONE in your country in advance. Does SCOOTERRA ONE come in different colors? Yes. Principally every color and pattern is possible, even customization. How many colors we will be able to offer you to choose from, depends on how much support we get now. If you have a special request, let us know and we will see what we can do. :) Will specifications change after the campaign? We are still optimizing SCOOTERRA ONE to create the best electric scooter that you can find. Some parts might be replaced by more suitable and better options in order to meet this goal. Transparency with our features is very important to us because we know that this is essential for every customer. Is it really true I can get up to 100 km on a single charge? Yes. On average, you can reach 100km with a single charge. The reach however strongly depends on the driving style, weight and degree of the roads you usually take. Do I need a license to drive SCOOTERRA ONE? Yes you do. The scooters are 45 km/h fast. In Europe you need a type AM drivers license for scooters or a type B for cars. (Type B includes type AM) Check your countries provisions to find out, what kind of drivers license you need to ride a scooter. Who is responsible for any additional taxes, duties or VAT/GST? If you live in an European country the taxes are already included in the price. If you live outside of the European Union you are responsible for additional taxes. Please check the different regulation for your country. How long is the life cycle of your batteries? After 1000 times charging, which is approximately 100.000km, the capacity still is at 90%. How long is the battery charging time? It takes about 2-3 hours to charge one battery. A 10 Ah charger is included into the price. What kind of accessories do you currently have or can I expect in the near future? We plan to open our online shop in spring 2019. We will offer all spare parts for the scooters. Bit by bit we will also offer several accessories with which you can modify your individual scooter. This will include different seats, mirrors, shock absorbers, luggage racks etc.. Where can I repair the scooters? Our e-scooters have a simple construction and we use standardized parts. Because of this, it will be easy for you to get cheap spare parts and you can adress every workshop. We will start listing the workshops that have experience with our e-scooters. Currently, we are setting up a network of workshops who have experience with electric scooters. As many parts will be easy to replace and repair, we want to do DIY tutorials. Can I order multiple scooters for my company? Yes you can. Please contact us via crowd@scooterra.eu I live in Germany. Can I pick it up myself? Yes you can. Please contact us via crowd@scooterra.eu with the subject „PICKUP“ How to contact SCOOTERRA? Contact us via mail: crowd@scooterra.eu or find us at  www.scooterra.eu. Do you offer a guarantee? What‘s your warranty? There's a two years warranty on SCOOTERRA ONE. We will offer all necessary spare parts in order to repair the vehicle if needed. It is not possible for us to provide a guarantee for SCOOTERRA ONE at this early stage of our company. What is your returns-policy? Within 14 days after the arrival of your ordered scooter you can return it without any explanation of reasons. For the transport costs you have to pay yourself.

story: Missed the campaign? Don’t worry click here to get your johanson3!
story_txt:
Missed the campaign?
Don’t worry click here to get your johanson3!

story:
MOAR bikes take all the best features in existing electric bikes and enhance them with industry firsts — making them the most innovative and ultimate e-bikes on the market today.

With a battery of up to 80 miles of range, up to 31 mph top speed, and a multitude of advanced safety features, MOAR bikes are unlike any other electric bike. These bikes are also the only e-bikes that have full 100mm suspension, fat tires, and a foldable frame all in one patented design!

Powerful, fast, and unlike any e-bike on the market, MOAR distinguishes itself from the rest with its unmatched power, innovative safety features, sleek design, and incredibly smooth riding.

Zip through your commutes, run errands like boss, rip through trails, and have a ton of fun doing it.

What would make a weekend trip to a new city or a national park even better? Exploring it from the back of a powerful ebike.

MOAR bikes fold perfectly in half and features a removable front wheel — making it easy to stow and carry.

MOAR bikes are straight fun. Part of that fun is the ability to tackle not only cement and asphalt but also dirt and gravel. No road? No problem.

MOAR bikes use fat tires, powerful frames, and full 100mm dual suspension to give you the strength, durability, and maneuverability of a professional mountain bike. There’s no limit to where you can go or how much fun you can have.

With great power, comes great responsibility. We wanted to ensure a powerful and safe ride for everyone — so our safety features come standard without the need to upgrade or do messy DIYs. These features ensure you always get a safe and fun ride, no matter the circumstances.

MOAR bikes are equipped with both front and rear suspensions.

The full-suspension reduces wear and tear on your body and bike. It softens impact and reduces fatigue on your hands, legs, and joints. It also increases traction — letting you stay in control over rough terrain or higher speeds.

With 100mm of suspension travel, you can tear through city streets without worry or take it to the trail! MOAR will handle every bump, drop, crack, or hole like it was nothing.

The frame of the bike is made with 6061 aircraft grade aluminum — the same material used in some expensive premium cars. Despite the lightweight frame, MOAR is built to haul weight and endure extreme use. It can even carry up 275 lbs of weight.

The top grade aluminum also guarantees that your Moar ebike will not rust — a big factor if you live by the coast, humid climates, or anywhere where they salt the roads.

MOAR comes with a rear rack to make commuting and running errands easy. With the optional Quick Release Rack Mount, you can carry your groceries, or any other personal items you may want to bring on the go.

The sturdy rack is welded to the frame and independent of the rear suspension — ensuring your stuff stays stable and secure.

Bring fun back into the way you bike and commute. With a powerful motor, long-lasting battery, fat tires, dual suspension and so much more, MOAR bikes are guaranteed to be the most fun you've ever had on a bike.

Forget sitting in traffic, paying for gas, or the crowded hassle of public transit. Jump on MOAR and see just how fun your commute can get.

 

MOAR is co-founded by Ken, Valentina and Nemat.  We are a team of people passionate about e-bikes coming from varied backgrounds of advertising, engineering, fashion, desert motor racing, documentary making, photography, TV commercial productions and computer science.  We are tinkerers and makers. We like to do things the right way, which sometimes is not necessarily the easiest way. That is why we designed our own e-bikes with unique features that are best suited for e-biking, which you do not find on most of our competitors in the market. Features that you might find being adopted a few years down the road by other brands.  

We pride ourselves as being the market leader on innovations. That’s the way we like to keep it.

Our first campaign with our patented e-bike was a great success. Unfortunately the success brought with it a lot of challenges. We got beaten down a lot, made too many mistakes to list, but we always learned and worked hard, and eventually we managed to tackle them all. We were able to ship most of the orders except for a small number of backed orders which we will build and deliver upon with the new tweaked frames we have on our gen2 bikes.

 

We are taking all the lessons we have learned from the last campaign including numerous feedback rounds and inputs from our passionate backers and totally overhauled our production, fulfilment, and after sales servicing. We designed a refined frame, changed factories for better production processes, improved quality control, and changed our workflow. 

On top of that we have added something very exciting this time, another first in the e-bike market: A rear hub drive, 1000w compact re-gen motor that recharges your battery when you brake or go downhill.

This is something utterly exciting and we are proud to be the first to offer this on our O2 line of e-bikes.

We just want you to have the best ebike on the market!

story:
More information, at intervals, will be added to this description. Additionally, our blog is located at http://i.am.curiousviolet.jp/

 

IMPORTANT UPDATE

about order fulfillment

Here's the deal: The Greybox is going to get built. I'm building it right now. If this project does not meet its funding goals, everyone who orders a Greybox will still receive one. The only difference is that the shipping time will be longer due to us having to do more of the assembly work in-house. 

TL;DR: If you order a Greybox, you will get a Greybox. Guaranteed.

 

About the Greybox

A long time ago, when I was still in college, I designed and built this synthesizer: essentially, I gutted my old Nintendo Entertainment System, fitted the processor's sound hardware to MIDI via a microcontroller, and made of this a playable, usable, surprisingly versatile little chiptune synthesizer. I had plans to start a company around this project, but I ended up getting a job in Japan instead. The synthesizer itself was damaged in the move, and it languished in the closet for seven years.

Recently, I started my own company (Curious Violet) to make electronic musical instruments and effects. A friend pointed out that since I was so proud of having built the Greybox all those years ago, I should dig the project out, start manufacturing them, and give other chiptune lovers a chance to have a Greybox.

So what, exactly, can a Greybox do? Well, here are the...

Specifications

DIMENSIONS: 88mm (height), 482.6mm (width), 200mm (depth)

INPUTS: MIDI IN, Control Voltage, Gate, Power (+9VDC, 800mA)

OUTPUTS: Audio (mono, 1/4" phone jack), MIDI OUT, MIDI THRU

PATCH STORAGE: 128 patches for squarewave, 64 patches for triangle and noise.

SAMPLE STORAGE: 32kB of delta-modulation samples

STORAGE MEDIA: Internal memory, SD card

FIRMWARE: Can be updated by SD card or via MIDI SYSEX.

DISPLAY: 128x64 pixel, monochrome graphic LCD with backlight

SOFTWARE: Includes a program to create and index patches, to convert samples into delta-modulation format, and to manage sample libraries/key mappings.

 The Greybox is a rack-mount module and will fit into any standard 19" rack with 2U of space available.

The playable sound channels are: two squarewaves, one triangle wave, one noise waveform, and one delta-modulation "sample" channel. Each of these can be controlled by a separate MIDI channel, or the keyboard can be "split" into ranges for each channel.

The parameters that can be adjusted are:

SQUARE: Selectable duty cycle (25/50/75%), ADSTR envelope, portamento (on/off and speed), vibrato (on/off, speed and depth), frequency sweep (on/off, speed), envelope looping (on/off) and arpeggiator (on/off, speed).

TRIANGLE: Note length (T parameter of ADSTR envelope), portamento, vibrato and frequency sweep.

NOISE: Noise type (short/long sequence), ADSTR envelope

SAMPLE: Playback rate

In addition, the two squarewave channels can be combined for additional effects: chorus (on/off, semitone offset, amplitude) and phaser (on/off, phase separation).

A "POLY" switch on the front panel activates a limited 2-voice polyphony mode that allows both squarewave channels to be controlled by the same MIDI channel. In this mode, all "effect" settings are copied from Square 1 to Square 2, for consistency in sound.

Finally, although it is not strictly "synthesis" related, an audio player application allows playback of NSF files stored on the SD card.

What We're Doing

In addition to getting the Greybox out there and in the hands of enthusiasts, we are correcting a number of bugs and flaws in the original Greybox's implementation. We are also adding several features that testers had remarked upon. We have figured $20,000 and three months to polish the hard/firmware and get the first production run (150 units) manufactured. 

FIXING AND POLISHING

By "polish" we mean things like:

All those 74-series logic chips will be rolled into a single CPLD. And naturally, by the time  we go to production, there won't be any need for jumper wires to correct circuit flaws.

We also mean things like:

The original Greybox was terrible about managing its own power. The 5V linear regulator was the only power source in the system, and what with the synth itself wasting power left and right, it would heat up terribly, threatening to go into auto-shutdown. The new Greybox has a sane power scheme.

EXPANDING

The original Greybox was a usable little synthesizer, but it lacked some things that would have made it a great piece of gear. All those things will be added into the new Greybox. Just to name a few:

A more flexible arpeggiator: using the KORG Polysix arpeggiator as a reference.

A better user interface: using a 128x64 graphical LCD screen instead of the 16x2 character screen on the original Greybox.

CV/Gate inputs: in addition to MIDI, the Greybox can now be controlled with CV/Gate signals.

Capability to play music files: the new Greybox has an SD card slot for bulk data save/restore, and any NSF files on the same SD card can be played.

MANUFACTURING

All the funds we raise go into the Greyboxes: printed circuit boards, parts, board assembly, custom enclosure drilling and etching, and the final assembly and test before shipping. As we were doing the math on manufacturing, the 150-unit point was where costs started to stabilize and economies of scale started to kick in. 

If we fail to reach our funding goal, we will still fill orders, but may end up taking longer as we have to stretch less money further. 

As the Greybox is essentially "rising from its ashes" of the synthesizer built seven years ago, we thought it was appropriate to break up the original synth and make pieces of it a "perk." We particularly like connecting the present with the past like this, and think it's a really fun perk.

Why Bother?

Because even with chiptunes becoming popular and even relatively mainstream, there is still no hardware equivalent of the SIDstation for the Famicom's sound. The console that single-handedly turned around the fate of video games in America is left in the lurch while other, less notable consoles go on to have their sound chips turned into proper instruments. To the best of my knowledge there is not a hardware solution available yet that will allow you to plug in a MIDI keyboard and just play. That is what the Greybox is about.

Other Ways To Help

If you love the idea of the Greybox but just aren't in a position to contribute, you can help us out mostly by spreading the word. Link your friends to this page, post about it on forums; just about any kind of exposure will help us get noticed and funded!

story:
We came to Sketchfest  to show our movie Pro-Can (ibalizm) to Ottawa. Came and shared our art for free, and left with a destroyed car which costs 600$ to repair...pretty shitty!

I'm asking everyone to give us a bit of money, so we can fix it... if you all give 5 to 10 bucks, it will be repaid in no time!


Please help us :D


Merci, Pro-Can Crew from Montreal

story:
Nuestro objetivo: la EME18-E

Necesitamos financiación para completar la fabricación de la EME18-E: Nuestra moto de competición 100% eléctrica. En la columna de la derecha encontrarás diferentes opciones de financiación, en la que obtendrás diferentes recompensas según la cantidad aportada.

Sigue leyendo y conoce más detalles de nuestro proyecto.

¡Muchas gracias por tu colaboración!

Diseño 3D de la nueva EME18-E

Quiénes somos

 

Somos UPM MotoStudent, una asociación sin ánimo de lucro formada por estudiantes de la Universidad Politécnica de Madrid.

  • Diseñamos y fabricamos motocicletas de carreras. Participamos en MotoStudent, competición internacional que se celebra en el circuito de Motorland.
  • En el año 2016 desarrollamos el primer prototipo eléctrico, la EME16-E, logrando la segunda posición en carrera. Actualmente estamos ultimando el desarrollo del nuevo prototipo, la EME18-E, buscando mejorar las prestaciones de nuestro anterior modelo
  • Entre nuestros objetivos están también fomentar el desarrollo de la movilidad eléctrica, crear conciencia sobre el desarrollo sostenible y apoyar la educación en ingeniería

Nos resulta imprescindible contar con tu ayuda: Con esta campaña buscamos obtener los fondos necesarios para el material con el que completar la fabricación nuestro prototipo, probar cada uno de los componentes y obtener los mejores resultados en la pista.

 

¡Necesitamos tu ayuda!

La construcción de una moto de competición eléctrica es un proyecto muy ambicioso y que requiere una gran dedicación. Hemos diseñado, fabricado y comprado ya muchos de sus componentes y ahora necesitamos vuestra ayuda para terminar nuestra EME18-E.

En la columna de la derecha puedes ver distintas cantidades para donar con la que obtendrás diferentes recompensas. Utilizaremos los fondos obtenidos para:

  • Fabricar y soldar el chasis
  • Comprar componentes eléctricos y mecánicos
  • Implementar un sistema de telemetría
  • Realizar test en circuito
  • ¡Ir a Motorland a por todas!

Pero nuestro proyecto va más allá. Estamos convencidos de que es necesario un cambio hacia una sociedad más sostenible, y este proyecto es una gran manera de colaborar en la transición a la movilidad eléctrica y a la integración de formas de energía más respetuosas con el medio ambiente. La experiencia que adquirimos durante todos estos años es parte de nuestra formación como ingenieros, y lo que ahora es nuestra innovación será la realidad del mañana.

 

¿Qué obtienes a cambio?

Como agradecimiento, todos los que colaboréis en nuestro proyecto podréis ver vuestro nombre sobre nuestra moto junto al del resto de colaboradores.

Además, según la cantidad donada, recibirás diferentes obsequios como agradecimiento: una batería portátil, la equipación oficial del equipo o incluso un curso de moto en circuito con nuestra piloto Sara Román como monitora. ¡Échale un ojo al panel de recompensas de la derecha! Si prefieres cambiar alguna de las mismas o tienes alguna sugerencia, no dudes en contactar con nosotros.

También estamos dispuestos a colaborar con entidades que decidan patrocinarnos: eventos, ferias, cursos… Si tienes una empresa o conoces a una que quiera contribuir con el proyecto ¡¡no dudes ni un momento en contactarnos a través de nuestra web, correo o redes sociales!!

 

La técnica detrás de nuestra moto

Nuestra motocicleta es el equivalente a una categoría eléctrica de Moto3. Es nuestra intención convertirnos en un equipo referente en competición eléctrica.

La competición en MotoStudent nos obliga a adaptarnos a su propio reglamento, lo que nos obliga a usar ciertos componentes a todos los equipos: motor, llantas, neumáticos, pinzas y bombas de freno.

Nuestro primer modelo, la EME16-E fue todo un éxito, y desde entonces hemos introducido cambios con los que se ha notado una gran mejoría en las pruebas realizadas en en el circuito del Jarama:

  • Cambios en la gestión electrónica del motor
  • Modificación de las suspensiones
  • Perfeccionamiento de los reglajes por la experiencia adquirida en circuito.

Sistema de control de baterías de la EME16-E

El nuevo prototipo EME18-E parte de la experiencia adquirida durante los años anteriores y se ha buscado mejorar en todos los aspectos:

  • Importante reducción global del peso
  • Mejora en prestaciones y peso de la batería
  • Incorporación de un sistema de telemetría
  • Evolución en las suspensiones

Contará con el siguiente equipamiento:

  • Motor Motenergy - 13kW nominales – 48kW pico – 120Nm par máximo.
  • Pack de baterías de diseño propio - Celdas Samsung Ion-Li 18650
  • Chasis de doble viga y basculante de diseño propio
  • Horquilla delantera Showa – Andreani MHS
  • Elementos en fibra de carbono de fabricación propia

El diseño ya está prácticamente cerrado... solo nos quedan pulir unos últimos detalles y conseguir los fondos para ultimar la fabricación. ¡Ayúdanos a hacerlo posible!

 

Contacta con nosotros

Puedes visitarnos en nuestra web: www.upm-motostudent.com/electric

O escribirnos al correo electrónico: eme.etsidi@gmail.com

También te invitamos a que nos sigasen nuestras redes sociales, donde publicamos todos nuestros avances:

Facebook: www.facebook.com/upm.motostudent.electric

Twitter: www.twitter.com/upm_motostudent

Instagram: www.instagram.com/upm_motostudent

story:
See how the glasses work in our product video.

 

 
 

 

Rear vision - without turning your head or destabilising cycling performance, helping you make smarter decisions

Better cycling performance - preserve aero and know where your competition is
Safer cycling - see threats and hazards in front and behind at the same time
Stylish - our eco-friendly hemp frames are exclusive to sports eyewear through HindSight, matching style with winning performance while protecting the environment

 

 

Rear vision is important to anyone on the road. So important that it’s illegal for most road users not to have any. If rear vision is so important, why do cyclists have no good options?

HindSight's view is that knowing what's coming behind you shouldn't require that you sacrifice your forward vision.

 

 

Achieve vastly improved awareness of your surroundings.

Scientifically engineered for cyclists, HindSight glasses put control of their surroundings firmly in the hands of users by allowing them unparalleled situational awareness. 

 

Do the mirrors block my vision?

 

HindSight eyewear allows both competitive cyclists and commuters to achieve vastly improved awareness of their surroundings. HindSight enables you to make better, safer, smarter decisions in less time and with more information.

This is how far a cyclist can travel in just one second:

 

 

 

How well do the glasses work? Well, we asked some local Scottish cyclists for their thoughts...

 

Change the way you see your commute. Forever.

 

If your cycling goals include performance, safety or style, investing now in a pair of HindSight Edge premium cycling glasses will put you in the company of Olympians, demanding peak performance and a safer cycling experience. 

 

"When I first tried HindSight glasses it was a complete no-brainer I didn't really want to take them off." - Callum Skinner

 

 What's in the box?

 

 

Empower your ride. Empower your journey. Empower yourself.

Our glasses feature patent-pending, scientifically designed rear-view mirrors. Full forward vision, with added rear vision. No loss in periphery giving you a full understanding of the road.

 

 

Here's a prototype demo of what the glasses provide you with:

 

As you can see, HindSight's rear vision allows simultaneous front and rear vision with no forward impairment - looking ahead or behind is your choice - 100% of the time.

 

Act with more information and feel significantly safer while on the roads.

Being road aware is fundamental to being safe while cycling and, at HindSight, our goal is to make our users as conscious of potential dangers as possible.

 

Elegance through simplicity.

Working with an award-winning optisystems engineer, we brought our concept to life by creating a complex mathematical model based on cyclists’ behaviour. Using metrics such as average interpupillary distance and head rotation rates, HindSight’s patent pending angled lenses are optimised to provide the best possible rear field of view. 

Be where the world is going.

Almost every lens manufacturer we spoke to has told us that making our lens would be impossible, we proved them wrong.

We take great pride in being the first-to-market with our patent pending Technology, and in this KickStarter campaign, bringing your search for cycling awareness to an end.

 

 

HindSight launches with 3 material finishes to suit every cyclist. To contain our 'Impossible' lenses, our frames had to be made of something equally impressive. We chose both high-grade sports plastics for a classic experience, and the world's strongest natural fibre for an eco-friendly flavour.

 

HindSight's Hemp & Hemp Core frames are all hand made in Scotland by Sam.

No setup, no fiddling, no maintenance, good to go straight out of the box.

Rear vision is considered so essential to safe road use that every other vehicle on the road is required by law to have mirrors, and now finally cyclists have a solution specifically for their lifestyle.

We saw the need to develop EDGE because we find that existing solutions are all too difficult to use, odd-looking, or simply not lifestyle intuitive. They need lots of complex setup and maintenance. EDGE by HindSight gives you a larger field of view with less head turn required. No setup, no fiddling, no maintenance, good to go straight out of the box.

HindSight's mission is to change the way the world cycles for the better - and not look back.

The concept for HindSight came from Alex having several near misses with traffic in London. As a cyclist, he realized that knowing what was coming behind would allow him to make smarter decisions. 

Whether that was a boy racer, an agressively driving taxi, or a large bus which requires more space, that knowledge would allow him to act with more information and make him feel significantly safer while on the roads.

 

 

Risks and challenges

HindSight has come a long way from our initial concept three years ago. We have developed and tested numerous prototypes, learnt many lessons and collaborated with some of the top designers and engineers in the UK to bring you the production-ready designs you see now. Our designs have been refined by experienced eyewear specialists – and fellow Indiegogo alumni – with their help we have sourced the materials and expertise necessary to bring HindSight’s pioneering glasses to Indiegogo . As with many new product launches, there may be unforeseen factors that result in a delay. Through extensive testing and iteration we have ruled out many unexpected events and we have been very conservative on our timeline. It may be the case that we can deliver your HindSight glasses even sooner, but there may also be a possibility of some delay, especially with the current world-wide uncertainty around COVID-19. We will do our absolute best to deliver the highest quality product to you as soon as possible and to communicate effectively and regularly about our progress along the way. Please know that our team is dedicated to bringing HindSight to life. Should there be speed bumps on our journey, you can expect us to be transparent with you and communicate with you regularly as to how we are addressing any issues. Thank you for supporting HindSight!

Sustainable materials

Two of our models utilise eco-friendly Hemp materials, ensureing both durability and a happy planet.

Environmentally friendly factories

Our Hemp models are handmade in an eco-friendly factory in Scotland.
