A simple super lightweight electric scooter by itself

 
Top Media Coverage


"...the Briefcase Electric Scooter is actually a working suitcase made for carrying your clothes. However, when the need arises, it folds out to become a motorized scooter capable of reaching speeds of up to 20 km/h (12 mph) and traveling 10 km (6.2 miles) on a single charge."
"...so finally someone has upgraded the suitcase scooter with an electric motor so it's now self-propelled."
 
 
The Specs
Colors： Soft backpack style(black and grey)
                  Semi-hard shell suitcase(black and dark blue)
Easy folding system turns it into a compact carryon size in seconds
Speed:  Up to 20 km/hr (about 12 miles per hour)
Range: Up to 10 km (about 6 miles)  per full charge
Motor power: 200 watt
Braking system: Double brakes with electronic regenerative brake and fender brake
Battery: 23 V and about 4 Ah capacity=92watt hours(meet most airlines' carryon requirements)
Double your range by getting an extra battery for only $79 USD!
Weight:  Less than 10 lbs for the scooter (this is the lightest e scooter in its class in the world!) and Fortunately Airlines rarely weigh your carry on
Loading capacity: Up to 100 Kg （about 220 lbs)
Wheels:  Durable polyurethane wheels
High quality Lithium Ion battery: 4.6 Ah and 23 Volt that meets most airlines' carryon regulations!  (similar to batteries in the Tesla)
Charge time: 2-3 hours
Charger: Super lightweight and compact charger, similar to your laptop charger
Cool extra feature: 
USB charging port for your gadgets
 
Ways the Coolpeds CarryOnE can help you:
1. Last mile connection to your office, subway and train stations.
2. Speeding across school campuses.
3. Getting to the boarding gates ahead of everyone!
4. Sight seeing when you travel around the world & grab that late night snack near your hotel.
5. And thousands of other ways only limited by your imagination.
 
Your contribution will change the world

Coolpeds USA's mission is to provide fun, reliable, and affordable green transportation to everyone around the world.  We came up with revolutionary award winning electric scooters before and we continue to work on innovative products for all of you!
Tony Chan, founder, serial tech entrepreneur, graduated from UCLA and worked at Microsoft, Seattle, as a software engineer.  He left Microsoft many years to start his product design and manufacturing company and successfully supplied various cool products to Sears, Walgreens, Lowe's, and many other global companies.  In addition, the Coolpeds team has won many international awards for campaigns in improving the environment and society.
Our goal is to provide you a cooler and easier lifestyle while making the world a little greener.
GET YOURS AT UP TO 50% DISCOUNT NOW!

story:
What is  ?
Do you like to shop?

Do you like to shop with friends?

Do you like to share the things you shop for with your friends?

Do you like free and/or discounted products and services?

What if you could earn free products and services just by having a healthy network of friends?

Yes, we agree...that WOULD be pretty awesome

Allow us to introduce you to the future of loyalty (which is now the present). No you didn't just travel through time. Stop freaking out..

Couponomy is revolutionizing the loyalty market by utilizing a proprietary point distribution process (patent pending) that creates a marketing effect unlike any other. 

Customers share loyalty points and transaction activity with a potentially limitless network of friends.

Here are some samples of our progress...




Our Mission

The story of Couponomy began like most, with a dream - a dream of a world connecting and cooperating effortlessly.

Our goal was to create a method where purchases could generate loyalty for both themselves and their friends, spreading both awareness and incentive to more people, encouraging more spending, and sharing more loyalty.

As consumers, our experiences with deal and loyalty programs have been tiresome at best. Email blasts from daily deal sites clog our inboxes and loyalty cards clog our wallets. Couponomy addresses these issues with a fun, simple, and most importantly, free mobile application. 

With Couponomy, you can make purchases and earn loyalty points all from your smartphone while automatically sharing and earning points with your friends. We always want to know where our friends eat, shop, and spend. 

Other than serving as a shared, viral loyalty program, Couponomy acts as a more targeted recommendation application, since you earn points from your friends, automatically opting you into that specific venue’s loyalty network.  

Who wouldn’t want to be rewarded for their friends’ loyalty? WE TOTALLY WOULD.What business wouldn’t want to access and attract their loyal customers' friends? You are the missing piece of the puzzle! 


Are you a business?



Here's Where YOU Come In!

Your support and pledges will advance our development and marketing budget to push beyond BETA and into the market. We look forward to bringing you an exciting, useful and reliable product.

The funds we raise on Indiegogo will allow us to:

  • Complete our iOS Mobile Application (currently in BETA)
  • Start and complete our Android Mobile Application
  • Add talented members to our already talented team
  • Rollout our software to your favorite locations!


Here are some of our Perks!

Official Indiegogo T-shirt FRONT

Official Indiegogo T-shirt BACK


Exclusive Couponomy Silicon (glow in the dark) bracelet


Here's the venue for our Launch Party!


Check us out at NY Tech Day 2014!

Our Founder & CEO, Michael posing by the Orange Fortress (wooden table, two uncomfortable chairs).


Michael Ross, Founder & CEO (left) with Brandon Fassberg, Operations Manager (right).


Michael answering questions like a pro..


If you came to our booth, you were a very lucky ducky because you got free cookies that were made with love.


We couldn't find Waldo. Maybe you can?

story:
World’s Lightest, Most Powerful Jump Starter

 

The GOOLOO G2000 is the world’s lightest, most powerful car jump starter that can start any 12V gas or diesel car up to 40 times. It also doubles as a powerbank for all your devices, too.

Check out GOOLOO G2000 jump starting this dead battery -

The G2000 is coming to life! We made a small production run and are conducting charging tests with each of the units:
 

The Only Power Device You'll Ever Need

Get an all-in-one jump starter, power bank and type-C adapter at an affordable price.

Don't just take our word for it. Hear from a mechanic why the GOOLOO G2000 is the must-have safety product for your car.

As Seen In

Click here for the press kit

Features to Save the Day

The G2000 comes packed with features to save the day. From 2,000 peak amps to integrated shock proof safety protection to SOS lighting. We've got all your driving safety needs covered.

Incredibly Lightweight, 1.5x More Powerful

At 2,000 peak amps and just 1.8 pounds, the G2000 is 1.5 times more powerful and lighter than anything else on the market. From jumpstarting a vehicle in a snow-bound carpark, helping out a work colleague whose battery has failed, to keeping personal devices topped-up, the G2000 does it all with ease.

40 Jump Starts on a Single Charge

The 28,800 mAh capacity powers all 12V engines. The slimline lithium-ion battery is compact for easy storage and packs a real punch. So much punch that you can jump start a 12V car 40 times on one single charge.

How GOOLOO G2000 Work

Hear the GOOLOO Guru walk you through how to use your G2000!

Jumpstart from Your Car's Cigarette Lighter

With the G2000, there’s no need to open the hood of the car or figure out how to use cables to jumpstart the car. Simply plug the G2000 into the cigarette lighter socket to charge dead car batteries and jumpstart the car.

Battery Booster and Portable Power Source

The rugged exterior boasts a unique combination of outlets, to charge laptops, mobile phones, or tablets to name a few. A built-in three mode LED light (high, strobe and SOS) enhances driver safety.

It’s the first car jump starter with a Type-C PD 60W outlet to support 20V/3A connection and is widely compatible with electronics like Apple laptops, the Nintendo Switch, Google Chromebook, Google Pixel, Nexus phones and more.

Quickly Charges in Eight Hours

The G2000 charges in eight hours via a normal wall socket or an in-car 12V cigarette lighter output. It charges in just four hours with quick charge.

Intuitive Smart Cables

The ‘smart cable’ provides an easy-to-understand jump-starting sequence. If it's green, you're good to go.

Integrated System Keeps Everything Safe

The G2000 features built-in safety provisions including fuse protection, spark-proof connections and reverse polarity protection that protects from overcharge or discharge.

But Wait, There's More

The G2000 is also equipped with a cigarette lighter socket adapter to support DC currents to electronic appliances such as vacuums and tire inflators.

Powerful, Portable and Affordable

What's in the Box

G2000 Technical Specs

Perks

1. Jump start all 12V Gas or Diesel engines with 2,000 Peak Amps
2. 28,800mAh capacity
​3. USB-C 60W output

For those looking for a lower-powered jump starter, we also have the G1500 available:

1. Jump start 8.0L Gas or 6.5L Diesel Engine with 1,500 Peak Amps
2. 19,800mAh capacity
3. USB-C 15W output

Early Concepts

Built entirely for the ease and convenience of our customers, our designs have been tested and proven. We’ve been working to perfect the technology and make sure it’s just right for you.

Late-stage drawings of the GOOLOO G2000.

Testing the output voltage.

On Track to Deliver

Top-Rated Jump Starter

Don’t just take our word for it--GOOLOO car jump starters have been tried, tested, and reviewed by thousands of people. GOOLOO sold ten thousand car jump starters within three hours of Amazon Prime Day 2017.

Meet the Team

GOOLOO designs and manufactures high capacity, safe and reliable car jump starters. It is committed to research and development to bring customers the most effective power source for all occasions, whether powering a laptop or jump starting a vehicle. A top seller on Amazon with hundreds of positive reviews the company aims to bring further popular battery power devices to the market. GOOLOO sold ten thousand car jump starters within three hours of Amazon Prime Day 2017.

Left to right: David Tu, Xerro Chou, Nikki Feng, Lahm Chan

Why are we crowdfunding?

When you’re trying to build great product, you need the support of a passionate community. That’s exactly why we’re here. Your ideas and feedback are vital to our product development efforts. As we prepare to enter production for the G2000, we know we can build a world-class car jump starter. Where we really need your help is understanding all of the ways you want to use it and the different features you like and what you want more of. And when you receive your very own G2000, we’ll be very eager to learn how we can make it better.

Help Out By Sharing With Friends

Like what you're seeing? Want to help? Just 30 seconds of your time could make the difference in growing the community. Hit one of the buttons below and tag a friend or coworker who needs this!

The more people who know about us, the larger our community will become! And the larger the community, the better we'll be able to make the product!

We can't do this without you.

FAQ

What is it?

The G2000 is lightest, most powerful jump starter that can start any 12V car up to 40 times. It is also capable of charging electronics through it's USB ports and a 12V output

How does it work?

The smart cable leads are connected on either side of the dead battery. A set of lights will notify you when the leads are positioned correctly. When it is correctly positioned you will be able to start your car. Alternatively you can use the cigarette lighter in your car to charge your car battery from inside the car, it will then start as normal.
Does this work with both gas and diesel engines?

Yes! The GOOLOO G2000 can jumpstart all 12V gas or diesel engines.

What can I use it for?

It is an all weather companion and a helping hand when you need it most. It can help save the day by starting your car, charging your electronic devices or illuminating those difficult to see problems.

What is the uniqueness of the technology?

At 2,000 peak amps, the G2000 is 1.5x more powerful than anything else on the market. It is also able to start a dead car battery right from the cigarette lighter socket inside the car.

What is the battery life of the G2000? How do I charge it?

The G2000 charges in eight hours via a normal wall socket or an in-car 12V cigarette lighter output. It charges in just four hours with quick charge.

How do I know when the G2000 is correct connected to the battery?

When the clamps are correctly connected to the car battery, the jumper cable indicator light will shine a steady green light. If the light flashes red, please switch the clamps and try again.

What is the Type-C output?​

The Type-C output allows the G2000 to charge electronics like Apple laptops, the Nintendo Switch, Google Chromebook, Google Pixel, Nexus phones and more.

Where does the G2000 ship?

We are able to ship worldwide. Please check out to see the shipping cost for your country.

Is there a warranty?

Yes, we've included a 12-month warranty with the G2000.

If I have other questions, who should I contact?

You can reach us at contactus@gooloobox.com with any other questions.

story:
Why?

Over the course of the last few years there has been an ongoing change in energy policy all around the world. It is obvious that we will not be able to rely on fossil fuels in the future. Because of this reason we have to find alternative energy sources and also integrate them into the worldwide energy production. But not only we need new energy sources, we will also be in need of new ways and gadgets to use the power. This is exactly why the four of us chose to focus on the construction of a high-efficiency electric motor, because the car of tomorrow is very likely to be either a hybrid car, a combination of a combustion engine and an electric motor, or a vehicle which will be fully driven by electric energy.

Background

We are a group of four very passionate students in the field of electrical engineering, who are trying to show the nearly endless possibilitys concerning the newest generation of electric engines. Our team consists of Aisha, Stefan, Frederick and myself, Mike. All of us are currently in our last year at the higher technical collage in Bad Radkersburg/Austria and our graduation is nearing closer. As our diploma thesis, our task is to construct and build a brushless dc machine and to dimension and design the required power electronics. As a result, our motor will be used as the drivetrain for our E-GoKart.

For us, this is a quite big project and we consider this as our contribution referring to the turnaround in energy policy.

Our school is quite small and thus our budget is very low. Because of the high costs – especially concerning the accumulators – we would be very happy if we could count on this community´s help to fulfill our important project. 

Our Project

· Totally self-made

Everything on our cart is self-made, even the motor is self-coiled. The inverter is self-designed, and so on..

· 8kW-16kW

It depends on the accumulators we get how much power our brushless machine will have. As you can see, we used a thick wire thus we only have 33mΩ resistance.


· Driving test bench

We are programming a driving test bench with an Arduino Due & a Raspberry PI, comparable with those on Formula 1.

The prototype is already working, we can see the torque, number of revolutions, current, voltage, and more data live on the PC and phone, additionally the Raspberry PI writes a protocol of these values.

There are about 1000 values that are measured per second. On this chart you can see the relation between reputations per minute (rpm) and torque, also the expected torque at a reputation of 1500 per minute on 

· Good handling

We are trying our best to design the weight distribution to grand the best handling on the GoKart.

· Silent driving

Our GoKart will drive very silent. This is because we use a toothed belt as drive train and a sinusoidal voltage on the motor. 

Costs

Like already mentioned before, our school really lacks on the financial matters to contribute our research project. The accumulators of our GoKart are the most expensive parts of our project, 60 cells of a lithium-ion iron-phosphate accumulator make up ~3700€ (~5000$). Furthermore the accumulators need a special loading device, current sensors, a control display and special balancer modules, which cost altogether about 600€ (~820$). To control the physical data like RPM Torque Power temperature of the motor we need some controllers and displays which cost approximately 50€ (~70$). But the mechanical construction is the more expensive part. For example the lasering of the stack of shields was about 350€ (~480$), milling the end shields of our motor 150€ (~200$), manufacturing the rotor of the motor costs about 250€ (~340$), the 16 permanent magnets of our rotor about 200€ (~270$) and the chassis 650€ (~$880). 


We appreciate every donation, if you contribute a higher sum you get a sponsoring sticker on our cart and a remark in our diploma thesis which could be the basics for further research in the field of the electrification of automobiles.


/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////Update/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

Hey guys!

This is our first update on our project. We already achieved some important goals. For instance, we were finally able to do some first test-runs with our GoKart and well, as you can see in our newest video, it is going pretty smooth. Furthermore, we are hoping to get good motor-data like torque, the exact currents, voltages and powers thus we can redesign the required power-electronics for the final version. We are quite optimistic and happy about our progress and we will be trying to keep you updated.

story:
HIS BIKE HAS BEEN FOUND. No need to donate any more. I am going to donate what has been raised to Pedal Revolution 

http://www.pedalrevolution.org/social_mission/

Short Summary

One of my old high school teachers, Mr Douvos, who is now retired had his bike stolen. I am trying to raise money to get him a new one. 


Here is a link to the story, and a picture of his bike getting stolen

http://www.marinij.com/crimebeat/ci_25227715/san-rafael-neighborhood-volunteer-captures-daytime-theft-cellphone

If the bike is recovered I will donate the money to Pedal Revolution here in SF http://www.pedalrevolution.org/donate/

What We Need

Money for a new bike

The Impact

You get to help a retired school teacher get around and have a better life

Other Ways You Can Help

Just donate some money.

HIS BIKE HAS BEEN FOUND. No need to donate any more. I am going to donate what has been raised to Pedal Revolution 
http://www.pedalrevolution.org/social_mission/

story:
What is Lovetrack?

Lovetrack – is mobile app which makes your bike rides VISIBLE and BEAUTIFUL, helps you CHOOSE the ROUTE for the bike ride based on pictures and SHARE your MAGICAL cycling EXPERIENCE with your friends.

 

How does it work?

This is as simple as these few steps. Every time you jump on your bike, start the app before your ride and:

  • Press START RIDE to track your ride
  • Press TAKE PHOTO to take pictures during your ride
  • Press FINISH at the end of your ride
  • Review your pictures and share it with your friends right from your phone. 

Lovetrack Team

Our team consists of members who love bikes, track cycling, photography, video making and sharing the experience. We are three co-founders with complementary skills and knowledge in software and app development, marketing, business development, UI and UX design. We are highly motivated and aim to make your cycling experience even more beautiful.

Thanks to Wide Wings Studio for the great video. We consider those guys as part of our professional team.

We need your support!

We are running out of our savings for prototyping, design and development and working hard to bring Lovetrack for you. We need your support:

  • Your contribution will help us launch the app on iOS and Android devices. All collected funds will be used to finish the design and develop the app.
  • We have already got a very good feedback for this app from friends, colleagues, but we want to make sure you like it as well. You can contact us on Facebook, Twitter or our website.
  • Please spread the word for us if you like the idea. We all have friends who like bikes and cycling. We believe they would be interested and happy to know about Lovetrack.

We have tons of our own further ideas, but your ideas are always welcome as well. Don't miss the chance to influence Lovetrack app while development is still in progress.

If you have any suggestions, comments or want to find more information, please visit our website and follow us on Facebook, Twitter for news, updates and more.

Help us change the world for the better place to ride bikes!

What will you get?

We designed a beautiful iPhone and Samsung Galaxy case gifts as we appreciate your contributions. We consider Lovetrack app as a bike accessory, so we designed the case similar to the app design. Contribute now and get one or a few of them!

Important:

Please write us a comment what phone cases do you need when ordered at paypal checkout (view image), for example: 1 x iPhone 4s and 1 x Samsung galaxy S3. 

FAQ

Q) What operating systems supports Lovetrack app?
A) Lovetrack will work on iOS 5.0+, 6.0+ and Android 2.2+ operating systems.

Q) When can I download app from Apple App Store or Google Play?
A) At this moment the app is being developed. It will be available for download in April 2013 or little bit sooner.

Q) How much Lovetrack app will cost?
A) Lovetrack app will be free. We plan to use freemium business model so in the future we probably will have paid version of Lovetrack which will have more features than free one.

Q) Which countries do we ship to?
A) Lovetrack ships iPhone leather cases to more than 200 countries worldwide.  If you are unsure that we ship to your country please contact us at hello [at] lovetrackapp.com and we will confirm.

Q) What phone case sizes do you make? 
We make iPhone 4/4S,5 and Samsung Galaxy S2/S3 cases. Please write us a comment what phone cases do you need when ordered, for example: 1 x iPhone 4s and 1 x Samsung galaxy S3.

Q) I am a blogger, a journalist. I need more information.
A) If you are going to write about Lovetrack but need more information, contact us at hello@lovetrackapp.com or find the section Contact on our website. We really appreciate your support!

story:
For the past few months Nick has been preparing to drive in the Pirelli World Challenge series at the Mid-Ohio Sports Car Course over the weekend of August 13-15. As the weekend has approached unexpected costs have developed and plans have changed. Simply put, the cost of the weekend now surpasses the budget that Nick is able to afford. With the culmination of travel, lodging, track fees, and car insurance costs, Nick isn't quite able to manage it alone. That's why he needs your help!

By contributing to this crowd funding campaign not only will you be directly contributing to the development of Nick's racing career, but you will also be contributing to a very important charity that has a deep connection to Nick's family. A number of Nick's close family members live with diabetes and as the years have gone by Nick has been able to witness firsthand the difficulties and extra steps taken by his family members in order to live a normal life. That is why Nick has decided to donate 10% of all funds raised through this campaign to the Diabetes Research & Wellness Foundation. By contributing to Nick's crowd funding campaign you will not only be funding the search for a cure, but you will be directly aiding Nick's family along with millions of other people in the fight against diabetes.

To summarize the goals of this crowd funding campaign and to be as transparent and understandable as possible, it is best to say that this fund is a last minute endeavor. As stated before the cost of the race weekend has changed last minute and in order for Nick to race at all these additional funds need to be raised in order to even make it to the race track. Going along with that, it is still important and a trait that Nick strives to live by, which is to pay it forward. The including of a charity, specifically one that is personally connected with Nick’s life, was a must for this to happen. With that being said, let’s get Nick to the racetrack and help find a cure for diabetes all at once!

story:
With HAïKU we are offering a new solution: all the information is available in your smartphone, leave it on your pocket and we give you access to it. 

Like a smartwatch optimized for your bike with clear and precise information, and gesture control on when to access it.

 

 

In a world full of technology, we want to respect your bike ride and protect your safety. That’s why we made HAïKU simple to use and non-intrusive. When you need an information, it’s there. When you don’t, enjoy your ride!
 

Just wave to pull Info = GESTURE CONTROL

 

 

Easy to plug ... and ride !

 

 

Strong magnets + clip

 

 

Fits on any bike

  • add 6€ to your pledge (additional contribution) if you want an extra dock = it is the best way to easily use HAïKU on your different bikes
  • add 15€ to your pledge (additional contribution) if you want an 'universal' mount = it is the best way to be sure to use HAïKU on your motorcycle / scooter

 

 

Technical details:

  • 1 week batteries in normal use (~12h on a bike)
  • Micro USB charging
  • Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE 4.0 and over)

Compatible with all major flagship smartphones :

  • Apple : iPhone 4s and over
  • Android : Samsung S3 and over, Motorola G and over, Nexus 5 and over, etc.

We conceived HAïKU after trying different options and realizing how unsatisfactory all existing solutions are: 

 

 
 

 

 

Why IndieGogo InDemand ? 

We reached our goal on another crowdfunding platform and it seems to us the best way to continue our Crowdfunding effort. By pre-ordering HAIKU(s) and increasing the volume of our first industrial batch, you give us more flexibility in the ongoing industrialisation process - every EURO will be used in this purpose. 

We conceived HAIKU as a robust and efficient product for SMART URBAN CYCLISTS. Our vision of Design for Bike accessories is to simply and safely bring you useful features to enhance your everyday rides. We are very focused on making this vision and prototypes a great reality. Be sure that we continue to invest our time and your money in product development rather than in 'catchy Marketing, cross visibility and PR campaigns' or in Business Trade Show. 

JOIN OUR COMMUNITY OF BACKERS THAT SHARE A DREAM OF A SMOOTH RIDE IN THE CITY = WATCH OUR VIDEO ABOUT IT IN THE GALLERY TAB

 

 

Meet the Riders

We are a mutli-disciplinary team including Hardware engineering, Industrial design, Software development and of course Product & marketing. All in our early 30’s, we bring together the energy and creativity of youth and experience of several years of working in our fields of competence. And most of all we all love riding our bikes on daily basis to go around the city.

 

Prototyping History

 

Risks and Challenges

Making a hardware product is hard (as they say) and long (as we already experienced). The road ahead is strewn with potholes, but be sure that our dedication to making HAïKU a reality will live up to the challenge. Because we are passionate by this adventure that allows us to fulfill ourselves.

For industrialization we’ve partnered with 4MOD Technology a French manufacturer that produces electronic goods in their own factory (proximity + same ‘work culture’ + integrated plant = WIN). Their engineers is helping us finalize Design for Manufacture, make the best choice to create a robust product and settle ramp up and production. As far as Software is concerned, we know what we have to build and we are not promising a ‘content generated bike navigation that never fails’. To start we will simply bring existing bike Nav to your handlebar, we assessed the works that remains to be done and are confident we can do it and test it in the coming months. In the long run we want to build APIs so everyone can try his own hacks. But for the moment we are very focus on delivering on time a product "that just works".

Our shipping estimates are realistic, based on our contract with our partner and we will strive to respect them. We promise to do our best and always keep you updated.

Ride Safely, 
The ASPHALT Lab Team

story:
Summary

Taxi Gratis (translated: "Free Cab") is a personal humanitarian project, started in April, 2013. Being aware of the transportation problems the people with health/financial problems have when they must travel to/from hospitals, and also because i encountered the same problem with my mother (who died of cancer 3 years ago), i decided to get involved personally. I help people with health and financial problems, transporting them from/to the hospitals, when they have no alternatives. (handicapped persons, blind, people suffering of cancer,leukemia etc.) The national medical service doesn't provide a transportation vehicle for the people that are in bad condition when they get out from the hospitals. My heart is crying when i see them getting out of the hospitals, in crutches, receiving no assistance at all. I wish to help more people and i need your support to do it further.

What We Need

My name is Alex Bobes, i am 25 years old and i live in Bucharest, Romania. 

Funding the project since 2013 from my own earnings was hard, because i had to cover all the expenses (gasoline, car parts etc.), but i managed to do it and help around 10-15 persons/week. There are so many helpless people, old persons, handicapped&blind out there, they depend on us. I want to extend this project in all areas of Bucharest and be at their side when they need a helping hand.

You can see the project's history on our website (http://www.taxigratis.ro) and on our facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/Taxi.Gratis.ro).

Other Ways You Can Help

Taxi Gratis project is well known in Romania, we had some interviews in the press,tv stations, radio stations, but in time (usually), the humanitarian projects are quickly forgotten. 

  • Get the word out about our project, promote it in any way you can, share it, we are gratefull for your involvment. If more persons discover the project, the bigger is the chance to develop it and help faster the helpless people from Romania.

story:
The Fifth Level of Civilization

 

 

The I-Jet™

Not Another Flying Car! That is the reaction many people have to our I-Jet™. But a flying car is by definition a vehicle designed to travel at speed on roads and in the air, a car that flies. Being neither fish nor fowl they are always bad cars and even worse aircraft and the cost to buy and operate these toys for the rich ensure that they will never replace the automobile. While the I-Jet™ can taxi at slow speed it never needs to travel at speed on the ground although it could close to the ground on a cushion of air over rough or soft surfaces.

What then is an I-Jet™? Just another one of the hundreds of electric drones that we hear about every day? No, the I-Jet™ is a fundamentally different form of transportation. Based on new breakthroughs in ion propulsion in the atmosphere, AIP, the I-Jet™ has the potential to revolutionize transportation as we know it and take us to the fifth level of civilization.

Isn't ion propulsion just science fiction? No it is not but most "so called" experts will tell you that it is impractical due to its low thrust and terrible efficiency. That is the almost insurmountable obstacle that hampers AIP development. It is to dispell these misconceptions that the lengthy discussion that follows is necessary. Since there really are no "experts" who posess the knowledge we have gained in our 15 years of research who can advise you, the only way for you a potential supporter to understand that ion propulsion in the atmosphere is truly within our grasp is to read what we have provided below.

Why is the development of AIP and the I-Jet™ so important. Because of all the endlessly proposed flying vehicles only the I-Jet™ can replace the automobile. By moving all transportation off the ground into the air with nothing to obstruct the view, all accidents can be avoided saving over a million human lives and a billion animal lives each year. In addition, if you believe in global warming, the I-Jet™ because it emits no CO2, when it does replace the automobile it will ensure that every country that has pledged to reduce CO2 emissions will meet their goals because it will happen without them taking any action and it will cost them absolutely nothing.

What is next? While saving lives and undoing all the dammage done to the planet by the automobile are the two most important reasons why the I-Jet™ must be developed, there are so many more reasons as we show in the discussion below. That is why we are now requesting your support to begin the design and construction of an actual I-Jet™ prototype. If we are successful, all that you see below will happen because economics rules and the I-Jet™ will cost less to buy and operate than today's automobile.

So take your time. Read what we have presented below. If you have further questions contact us either by e-mail here on Indiegogo or go to our website at https://charged-motion.com.

Donations. Those who donate will be placed on the I-Jet priority list for lease or purchase when and if I-Jets™ become available. Note also that donations can be given as gifts and will place both the Donor and gift recipient on the I-Jet priority list. Additionally  Donations of $1000 place them on the CM Investment Invitation List on the CM website, 

 

 

We begin our story with this short clip from Star Trek the original series first broadcast in 1968.

 

 

But it was not just in our popular culture that the myth that efficient high thrust ion propulsion is always beyond our grasp. The few researchers still in the field will all tell you that ion propulsion in the atmosphere is impractical due to exceedingly low thrust and low efficiency. We at Charged Motion, after fifteen years of research believe that this is no longer true; that we are on the brink of making high-thrust high-efficiency ion propulsion in the atmosphere a reality.

 

What is ion propulsion?
The I-Jet
    Size
    Speed
    Mileage
    Speed vs. Mileage
    Safety
    Cost
    Cost to Operate
    Pilot's License
    No Moving Parts
    Dynamic Stability
    All Weather Capability
    The I-Jet is not a Flying Car
    How long will it take?
    The Electrostatic Propulsion Consortium (EPC)
    I-Jet or Automobile
    I-Jet or Flying Car
The Future
Why You Should Donate
    How the I-Jet will Benefit You
    Benefit Wildlife
    Eliminate Pollution
    Eliminate Poverty in the Third World
     Offer You New Thrills and Adventures
Further Information
    Who we are.
    A brief history of Ion Propulsion.
    Introduction to Transportation Issues.
    Transportation Issues Part 1: Conventional Solutions
    Transportation Issues Part 2: Proposed Solutions
    Transportation Issues Part 3: The I-Jet


 

What is ion propulsion?

Ion propulsion was first mentioned in 1905 by Dr. Robert Goddard the father of modern rocketry who filed the first ion propulsion patent over one hundred years ago in 1917. For those interested, a brief history of Ion Propulsion can be found at the end of this presentation. This next clip shows how ion propulsion works.

 

Ion engines have the following advantages over conventional mechanical methods of producing thrust such as piston and jet engines and electric motors.
 

 

1. Light weight: — An ion engine can consist of a few ounces of light weight aluminum or other conductive material attached to the vehicle adding little to the weight and cost of a vehicle.
2. Vectored thrust: — An ion engine can apply different voltages to multiple electrodes changing the magnitude and direction of its thrust without using any costly, complex and unreliable electromechanical or hydraulic actuators.
3 Low temperature operation: — An ion engine's exhaust temperature at full output is only a few degrees higher than its input temperature.
4 Response time: — An ion engine can go from zero to maximum thrust in a few microseconds and can vector that thrust just as quickly..
5 No moving parts: — An ion engine has no moving parts making it far more reliable than any other means of propulsion.

 

It is these five characteristics of an ion engine in the atmosphere that give an ion propelled vehicle its extraordinary capabilities.

If ion propulsion in the atmosphere does succeed, what will it mean for you and your family?

 

The I-Jet

 

 

 

 

Because it isn't obvious why the five characteristics of atmospheric ion engines when applied to a vehicle can so change the world, we have created a design study vehicle that we call an I-Jet™. The capabilities of this vehicle are based on simulations of our patented breakthrough ion propulsion technology. While theoretically almost 90% efficiency is possible, the following design study is very conservative and uses an overall thermodynamic efficiency of the ion engine of only 25%.


 

Size

The I-Jet is no larger than a conventional automobile, has vertical take-off and landing capabilities, and will fit in your garage.


Speed

Unlike propeller and jet engines, an ion engine has no theoretical limit to the speed it can achieve. It is strictly a matter of the power available and the drag of the vehicle. While the cost of current electrical power sources will make the I-Jet™ subsonic for most applications, when cheaper and more powerful electrical sources are developed or when cost is no object, supersonic and even hyper-sonic aircraft should be possible.


Mileage

Because it uses vectored thrust instead of aerodynamic control surfaces and has 1/10th the drag of an automobile at sea level and 1/100th the drag at 50,000 feet, from the speed graph above, it should be capable of speeds exceeding 450 miles per hour or have a range exceeding 1500 miles per GGE (gasoline gallon equivalent) and with a 20 GGE fuel capacity, it should have intercontinental range.


Speed vs. Mileage

Unlike vehicles powered by mechanical devices which usually have one speed that gives maximum mileage, an ion engine's mileage increases linearly the slower you go until you drop out of the sky. For this reason the user can select whether an I-Jet™ travels 10 times faster than an automobile or ten times farther.




Safety

With fly by wire computer control, external sensors, low temperature operation, and no moving parts it should be possible to create a zero-accident zero-fatality vehicle. With proper design because of the almost negligible added weight of redundant ion engine electrodes, should any system fail, the I-Jet™ can still make an emergency horizontal landings using small backup batteries or other electrical source.


Cost

Because our I-Jet™ will obtain its power from a 200 kw fuel cell that currently costs about $11,000, we believe that I-Jets could be manufactured today to sell for less than $25,000 and as volume increases and fuel cell prices continue to fall, for under $15,000. This is less than the price of the average automobile. As ion propulsion efficiency increases above 25% and the size of the fuel cell decreases, the cost will decrease even more.

This graph below was published in 2012 by the US Department of Energy. It showed the anticipated reduction in cost per kilowatt from 2006 to 2017. The actual cost in 2017 is now $53/kw so the projections were very optimistic. Currently the DOE's goals are $47/kw by 2020 with $30/kw still their eventual goal. These projections and the current $53/kw are for volumes of 100,000 units or more. The I-Jet™ with demand in the millions could completely change the curve by dropping costs much faster.


Cost to Operate

Many of the operating costs associated with operating an automobile should be greatly reduced if not eliminated with the I-Jet™. With no moving parts and no lubrication needed maintenance costs should be almost eliminated. Licenses should no longer be necessary since the user is not flying the vehicle. Registration will be a one time occurrence included in the cost of the vehicle. Since an I-Jet does not use roads or any other infrastructure and cannot "break the law", so that police resources are no longer required for transportation, the fuel tax which is almost 1/4 the cost of the fuel itself can be eliminated. If the I-Jet™ is truly a zero-accident zero-fatality vehicle insurance could also be eliminated. Whether these costs are eliminated is a political issue not a technical one.

With the I-Jet™ the actual cost of fuel to fly could be less than 7.5% of the automobile's fuel cost and the I-Jet™'s total operating costs could be less than one quarter that of the automobile''s total operating costs.


Pilot's License

Because the ion engine has vectored thrust capability that can be controlled directly by a computer without expensive mechanical or hydraulic linkages, what is known as fly by wire can be implemented at no additional cost. With fly by wire, it is the computer that flys the I-Jet™, the user simply tells the computer where it wants to go and how fast. The I-Jet™ is a truly autonomous vehicle and because it operates above the ground clutter, collision avoidance can be guaranteed. Since the user is not flying the vehicle, no pilots license will be required and in fact it will take less skill to operate than an automobile.


No Moving Parts

Once in the air the I-Jet™ will fly without any moving parts because the ion engine has no moving parts. You are literally flying on a cushion of air.


Dynamic Stability

Because the ion engine's response time is so fast and the I-Jet™ can be designed to provide vectored thrust in any direction, dynamic stability is easily implemented. With dynamic stability an ion engine instantaneously provides an opposing thrust to any outside force on the vehicle. Turbulence and wind shear will not be felt by the passengers and if the vehicle is built strong enough it could fly through a tornado with the occupants feeling nothing.


All Weather Capability

Dynamic stability will make the I-Jet™ a completely safe all weather aircraft.


The I-Jet is not a Flying Car

While the I-Jet™ can replace the automobile everywhere it is not a flying car. The reason why many people are designing flying cars is because these vehicles cannot operate safely in the air in bad weather and if they are to continue a trip safely in bad weather they must land and use conventional roads. Because the I-Jet™ can travel safely in any weather to any destination, travel on roads is never necessary.


How long will it take?

That will depend on the level of funding we obtain here and elsewhere. If there is sufficient funding we believe the simulator and prototype simulations will take between one and two years. Construction of a prototype can begin as soon as the simulator verifies the prototype engine performance, hopefully within a year. Due to the simplicity of the I-Jet and with sufficient further funding, construction of the prototype should be completed within a year after verification of the engine. Exhaustive testing and necessary government approvals will take at least three years. But during testing, again with sufficient funding, the final production I-Jet can be designed and production started so that deliveries can be made as soon as testing and approvals are complete. You could be traveling in an I-Jet in five to seven years.

The Electrostatic Propulsion Consortium (EPC)

As soon as possible Charged Motion, Inc will sponsor a conference inviting the leading automotive and aerospace companies to discuss the creation of The Electrostatic Propulsion Consortium, the EPC. The purpose of the Consortium is to bring together as many resources as possible in an effort to accellerate Atmospheric Ion Propulsion development. Through the EPC Charged Motion hopes to build a level playing field where all member companies and universities on an equal basis can initially obtain licensing to Charged Motion's intellectual property and in time all intellectual property of the EPC and all intellectual property that the EPC has a right to sub-license. The goal of the EPC is to save as many lives as possible both by accelerating AIP development and by removing any incentive for any licensee to cut corners on safety. The EPC will set absolute safety standards that all licensees will have to meet. These safety standards are not intended to replace governmental safety regulations but are instead intended to set higher safety standards when necessary.


I-Jet or Automobile
Feature I-Jet Automobile
Speed 0 to 450 Miles per hour 0 to 275 Miles per hour
Range 2,500 to 25,000 miles 50 to 400 miles
Cost $15,000 - $25,000 $12,000 - $4,800,000
Operating Costs $0.0025 per mile $0.60 per mile
Safety Zero Accidents? Zero Fatalities? 50 million Injuries. 1.2 million deaths.
Pollution 0 - 2.6 lbs/GGE 6.8 - 28 lbs/GGE


I-Jet or Flying Car
Vehicle Image Cost
(USD)		 Max Speed
(mph)		 Altitude
(ft)		 Range
(mi)		 Operating Cost
(USD)		 Licenses Pollution
(gm/mi)		 Safety
Flying Cars
Aeromobile $279,000? 124 <12,000 435 $1 - $2 P&D 254 Same as car or plane
Transition $279,000 107 10,000 489 $1 - $2 P&D 0 - 250 Same as car or plane?
Switchblade ? 175 <12,000 500 $1 - $2 P&D 0 - 250 Same as car or plane?
Skyblazer ? 400 <12,000 825 $1 - $2 P&D 0 - 250 Same as car or plane?

Summary: Flying cars make poor cars and poor airplanes with no real benefits over an automobile or airplane. Projected same fatality rate as general aviation, 10 times greater per mile and 20 times greater per hour. High cost makes them just toys for the rich.

VTOL Flying Cars
TFX $100,000+ 200 <10,000 500 $1 - $5 P&D 0 - 250 Same as car or plane?

Summary: Vertical flying cars make more sense but have limited range and performance. Projected same fatality rate as a helicopter, 27 times greater per mile and 85 times greater per hour. High cost also makes them just toys for the rich.

Electric propellers
EHang $300,000 63 11,500 24 $3 - $5 ? 0 - 2500 Very Dangerous to All
Volocopter ? ? ? ? ? ? 0-250 Same as a helicopter
Kitty Hawk ? 25 3 115 $1 - $5 None 0 - 2500 Same as car or plane?

Summary: Vertical lift propellers without the benefit of wings are the most inefficient means of travel. Projected fatality rate is unknown but is probably close to that of a helicopter, 27 times greater per mile and 85 times greater per hour for non-commercial travel. But they also are a real threat to people and property outside the vehicle. Would you rather be kneecapped or beheaded?

Electric Tilt-rotor
Lilium $250,000 - $500,000? 240 <12,000 300 $3 - $5 ? 0 - 250 Same as an airplane?
Joby S2 ? 200 <12,000 ? $3 - $5 ? 0 - 250 Same as an airplane?
Uber ? ? <12,000 ? ? ? 0 - 250 Same as an airplane?

Summary: Electric tilt-rotor aircraft like all battery powered aircraft have limited range due to the low energy density of batteries, less than 200 Wh/kg versus 12,000 Wh/kg for gasoline. Assuming 85% efficiency for electric motors and 20% efficiency for internal combustion engines, you can travel 14 times farther with a gasoline internal combustion engine than an equivalent electric motor. As to safety we only have the safety record of the V22 Osprey compared to a helicopter to asses the safety of these vehicles and they are comparable. If the fans are ducted then they will be safer for those outside the vehicle otherwise the vehicle must be segregated from people on the ground while in operation.

Gyroplane
Pal V $599,000 111 <10,000 220 - 250 $1 - $5 P&D 0 - 250 Same as car or plane?

Summary: Gyroplanes were never accepted by the public because the rotor caused more drag than a conventional aircraft wing of comparable lift and could not achieve the speeds that a conventional airplane could. The short take-off and landing capability could not match the zero take-off and landing capabilities of the helicopter. It would appear that the only advantage of the Pal-V is the ability to fold the rotor into a smaller space. Gyroplane safety is a hotly debated issue but the consensus seems to be that they are less safe than even a helicopter. The spinning rotor is also a hazard to those outside the vehicle and thus the vehicle must be segregated from people on the ground while in operation.

Ducted Fan
Cormorant ? 115 <10,000 115 $1 - $5 P&D 0 - 2500 Same as car or plane?
Moller Skycar 400 $500,000 331 35,000 805 $1 - $5 P&D 250 Same as car or plane?
Xplorair ? 400 9,000 300 $1 - $5 P 250 Same as car or plane?
Airbus ? ? ? ? ? ? ? Same as car or plane?

Summary: Ducted fans while much safer than open spinning blades are also generally less efficient. But the main safety issues with all of these vehicles is that if an engine fails, the vehicle is lost. It is for this reason that most of these vehicles have an on-board vehicle parachute. But these parachutes generally need at least 200 feet of altitude to properly deploy so that there is this window on take-offs and landings where the vehicle and pilot are at risk.

Paraglider
Skyrunner $139,000 40 <10,000 138 $1.25 P&D 0 - 2500 Same as car

Summary: Paragliders are generally low speed recreational aircraft and can't compete with other designs with regard to speed and distance and as the Skyrunner shows, they are not cheap. While there is no safety information on these types of vehicles, it would seem at best that they would not be any safer than other general aviation aircraft. The spinning propeller could also be a hazard to people outside the vehicle.

Electrostatic Propulsion
The I-Jet $10,000 - $50,000 400 - 700 50,000 4,000 - 24,000 $0.0025 - $0.42 None 0 - 25 Completely Safe
Summary: The I-Jet's ion propulsion engine solves all of the problems that limit these mechanical devices.
1. Range There are three reasons for the extreme range of the I-Jet; A) thrust efficiency, moving more air for a given thrust, B) thrust efficiency increases linearly as thrust decreases, and C) the low drag of the I-Jet because of the elimination of all aerodynamic control surfaces due to the vectored and multi-axis thrust of the ion engines.
2. Speed There are three reasons for the high speeds of the I-Jet; A) thrust efficiency, moving more air for a given thrust, B) thrust can be increased by using higher power fuel cells, and C) the low drag of the I-Jet because of the elimination of all aerodynamic control surfaces due to the vectored and multi-axis thrust of the ion engines.
3. Cost The low cost of an I-Jet is due to its simplicity, a pod with a fuel cell and a few hundred parts vs the thousands in an automobile, and when it replaces the automobile as the dominant form of transportation, production quantities in the millions exceeding even that of the automobile today will further lower costs.
4. Safety The low temperature operation and no moving parts greatly enhances safety for both the I-Jet user and those on the ground. To create an independent redundant engine simply add additional electrodes next to the original electrodes and because the I-Jet has wings, horizontal landings can still be made using a small emergency battery for power. In addition, the I-Jet's dynamic stabilization, all weather flying capability, and collision avoidance sensors will eliminate all in flight hazards.
5. Wildlife The only way to protect wildlife is to move transportation off the ground and eliminate as much ground travel as possible. Only the I-Jet can make an appreciable dent in ground transportation because of its all weather flight capability.
6. Pollution If the fuel used is hydrogen that is generated from non CO2 sources, emissions will be zero. If other fuels are used, emissions will still be reduced up to a factor of ten per mile traveled due to the I-Jet's greater gas mileage.

As the table shows, there has been so much time, money, and, effort expended by all these extremely creative, talented, and dedicated people trying to make the dream of flight available to all. But the physics of current mechanical devices limits what can be done. These devices are the fourth generation of flying vehicles. The I-Jet is the fifth.

So which would be your next vehicle if you could choose? Could the Automobile survive the I-Jet? Could any of the flying vehicles in the table above survive the I-Jet. We don't think so. How long it takes until you can purchase your own I-Jet is up to you.


The Future

Flying cars are not the future and we certainly hope that self-driving cars will not be the future either. Flying cars are too expensive and very dangerous and self-driving cars solve none of the issues facing modern transportation except perhaps in time, some improvement in safety. But all the mechanical flying cars which for most people will never be afordable and all the self-driving cars stuck on the ground will never compete with the I-Jet. The I-Jet will be much cheaper to own and operate than any alternative and economics rules.

If you have not watched our campaign video we suggest that you do so to see just what the fifth level of civilization will be like if and when atmospheric ion propulsion becomes the dominant form of transportation. If we are able to achieve 25% thermodynamic efficiency and our simulations indicate that we can, then all that is shown in the video will happen in the very near future.


Why You Should Donate


How the I-Jet will Benefit You

All that we have shown above should be reason enough for you to donate to this campaign. Nothing we can forsee in the area of transportation will benefit you and your family as much as the I-Jet will. Fly from your home coast to coast in six hours or New York to Paris in nine hours in complete safety at a cost under $50. The cost of shipping goods and material will be decreased by a factor of ten and these savings will be passed on to you the consumer. But the single most important reason for you to support us is the elimination of all transportation related deaths and injuries.


Benefit Wildlife

If you care about wildlife and the environment, nothing you could support could begin to approach the benefits to wildlife that the I-Jet will provide by eliminating over a billion animal deaths a year worldwide and, as roads are phased out, greatly reducing habitat fragmentation.


Eliminate Pollution

If you care about atmospheric pollution the I-Jet will eliminate all transportation related atmospheric pollutants including CO2. Also, it does not matter which side of the Climate Change debate you are on, the I-Jet really will be the only practical way to reach the targeted transportation related CO2 reductions because of the continued low cost of fossil fuels, all without costing the tens of trillions of dollars that current plans entail.


Eliminate Poverty in the Third World

If you care about poverty in third world countries you should support us. Because the I-Jet requires no roads or other infrastructure except fueling stations, the I-Jet really is the only way to bring third world countries that cannot afford the massive cost of modern transportation into the modern world.


Offer You New Thrills and Adventures

If all these reasons are not enough then consider all the thrills and adventures you and your children can experience when in a few years you own an I-Jet.


Further Information

Who we are.


A brief history of Ion Propulsion.


Introduction to Transportation Issues.


Transportation Issues Part 1: Conventional Solutions


Transportation Issues Part 2: Proposed Solutions


Transportation Issues Part 3: The I-Jet

The Fifth Level of Civilization  
The I-Jet™
Not Another Flying Car! That is the reaction many people have to our I-Jet™. But a flying car is by definition a vehicle designed to travel at speed on roads and in the air, a car that flies. Being neither fish nor fowl they are always bad cars and even worse aircraft and the cost to buy and operate these toys for the rich ensure that they will never replace the automobile. While the I-Jet™ can taxi at slow speed it never needs to travel at speed on the ground although it could close to the ground on a cushion of air over rough or soft surfaces.
What then is an I-Jet™? Just another one of the hundreds of electric drones that we hear about every day? No, the I-Jet™ is a fundamentally different form of transportation. Based on new breakthroughs in ion propulsion in the atmosphere, AIP, the I-Jet™ has the potential to revolutionize transportation as we know it and take us to the fifth level of civilization.
Isn't ion propulsion just science fiction? No it is not but most "so called" experts will tell you that it is impractical due to its low thrust and terrible efficiency. That is the almost insurmountable obstacle that hampers AIP development. It is to dispell these misconceptions that the lengthy discussion that follows is necessary. Since there really are no "experts" who posess the knowledge we have gained in our 15 years of research who can advise you, the only way for you a potential supporter to understand that ion propulsion in the atmosphere is truly within our grasp is to read what we have provided below.
Why is the development of AIP and the I-Jet™ so important. Because of all the endlessly proposed flying vehicles only the I-Jet™ can replace the automobile. By moving all transportation off the ground into the air with nothing to obstruct the view, all accidents can be avoided saving over a million human lives and a billion animal lives each year. In addition, if you believe in global warming, the I-Jet™ because it emits no CO2, when it does replace the automobile it will ensure that every country that has pledged to reduce CO2 emissions will meet their goals because it will happen without them taking any action and it will cost them absolutely nothing.
What is next? While saving lives and undoing all the dammage done to the planet by the automobile are the two most important reasons why the I-Jet™ must be developed, there are so many more reasons as we show in the discussion below. That is why we are now requesting your support to begin the design and construction of an actual I-Jet™ prototype. If we are successful, all that you see below will happen because economics rules and the I-Jet™ will cost less to buy and operate than today's automobile.
So take your time. Read what we have presented below. If you have further questions contact us either by e-mail here on Indiegogo or go to our website at https://charged-motion.com.
Donations. Those who donate will be placed on the I-Jet priority list for lease or purchase when and if I-Jets™ become available. Note also that donations can be given as gifts and will place both the Donor and gift recipient on the I-Jet priority list. Additionally  Donations of $1000 place them on the CM Investment Invitation List on the CM website, 
  We begin our story with this short clip from Star Trek the original series first broadcast in 1968.  But it was not just in our popular culture that the myth that efficient high thrust ion propulsion is always beyond our grasp. The few researchers still in the field will all tell you that ion propulsion in the atmosphere is impractical due to exceedingly low thrust and low efficiency. We at Charged Motion, after fifteen years of research believe that this is no longer true; that we are on the brink of making high-thrust high-efficiency ion propulsion in the atmosphere a reality. 
What is ion propulsion?The I-Jet    Size    Speed    Mileage    Speed vs. Mileage    Safety    Cost    Cost to Operate    Pilot's License    No Moving Parts    Dynamic Stability    All Weather Capability    The I-Jet is not a Flying Car    How long will it take?    The Electrostatic Propulsion Consortium (EPC)    I-Jet or Automobile    I-Jet or Flying CarThe FutureWhy You Should Donate    How the I-Jet will Benefit You    Benefit Wildlife    Eliminate Pollution    Eliminate Poverty in the Third World     Offer You New Thrills and AdventuresFurther Information    Who we are.    A brief history of Ion Propulsion.    Introduction to Transportation Issues.    Transportation Issues Part 1: Conventional Solutions    Transportation Issues Part 2: Proposed Solutions    Transportation Issues Part 3: The I-Jet
 What is ion propulsion?Ion propulsion was first mentioned in 1905 by Dr. Robert Goddard the father of modern rocketry who filed the first ion propulsion patent over one hundred years ago in 1917. For those interested, a brief history of Ion Propulsion can be found at the end of this presentation. This next clip shows how ion propulsion works. Ion engines have the following advantages over conventional mechanical methods of producing thrust such as piston and jet engines and electric motors.  

1.
Light weight:
—
An ion engine can consist of a few ounces of light weight aluminum or other conductive material attached to the vehicle adding little to the weight and cost of a vehicle.


2.
Vectored thrust:
—
An ion engine can apply different voltages to multiple electrodes changing the magnitude and direction of its thrust without using any costly, complex and unreliable electromechanical or hydraulic actuators.


3
Low temperature operation:
—
An ion engine's exhaust temperature at full output is only a few degrees higher than its input temperature.


4
Response time:
—
An ion engine can go from zero to maximum thrust in a few microseconds and can vector that thrust just as quickly..


5
No moving parts:
—
An ion engine has no moving parts making it far more reliable than any other means of propulsion.

 It is these five characteristics of an ion engine in the atmosphere that give an ion propelled vehicle its extraordinary capabilities.If ion propulsion in the atmosphere does succeed, what will it mean for you and your family? The I-Jet    Because it isn't obvious why the five characteristics of atmospheric ion engines when applied to a vehicle can so change the world, we have created a design study vehicle that we call an I-Jet™. The capabilities of this vehicle are based on simulations of our patented breakthrough ion propulsion technology. While theoretically almost 90% efficiency is possible, the following design study is very conservative and uses an overall thermodynamic efficiency of the ion engine of only 25%. SizeThe I-Jet is no larger than a conventional automobile, has vertical take-off and landing capabilities, and will fit in your garage.SpeedUnlike propeller and jet engines, an ion engine has no theoretical limit to the speed it can achieve. It is strictly a matter of the power available and the drag of the vehicle. While the cost of current electrical power sources will make the I-Jet™ subsonic for most applications, when cheaper and more powerful electrical sources are developed or when cost is no object, supersonic and even hyper-sonic aircraft should be possible.MileageBecause it uses vectored thrust instead of aerodynamic control surfaces and has 1/10th the drag of an automobile at sea level and 1/100th the drag at 50,000 feet, from the speed graph above, it should be capable of speeds exceeding 450 miles per hour or have a range exceeding 1500 miles per GGE (gasoline gallon equivalent) and with a 20 GGE fuel capacity, it should have intercontinental range.Speed vs. MileageUnlike vehicles powered by mechanical devices which usually have one speed that gives maximum mileage, an ion engine's mileage increases linearly the slower you go until you drop out of the sky. For this reason the user can select whether an I-Jet™ travels 10 times faster than an automobile or ten times farther.

Summary: Electric tilt-rotor aircraft like all battery powered aircraft have limited range due to the low energy density of batteries, less than 200 Wh/kg versus 12,000 Wh/kg for gasoline. Assuming 85% efficiency for electric motors and 20% efficiency for internal combustion engines, you can travel 14 times farther with a gasoline internal combustion engine than an equivalent electric motor. As to safety we only have the safety record of the V22 Osprey compared to a helicopter to asses the safety of these vehicles and they are comparable. If the fans are ducted then they will be safer for those outside the vehicle otherwise the vehicle must be segregated from people on the ground while in operation.
Gyroplane

Pal V

Summary: Gyroplanes were never accepted by the public because the rotor caused more drag than a conventional aircraft wing of comparable lift and could not achieve the speeds that a conventional airplane could. The short take-off and landing capability could not match the zero take-off and landing capabilities of the helicopter. It would appear that the only advantage of the Pal-V is the ability to fold the rotor into a smaller space. Gyroplane safety is a hotly debated issue but the consensus seems to be that they are less safe than even a helicopter. The spinning rotor is also a hazard to those outside the vehicle and thus the vehicle must be segregated from people on the ground while in operation.

Summary: Ducted fans while much safer than open spinning blades are also generally less efficient. But the main safety issues with all of these vehicles is that if an engine fails, the vehicle is lost. It is for this reason that most of these vehicles have an on-board vehicle parachute. But these parachutes generally need at least 200 feet of altitude to properly deploy so that there is this window on take-offs and landings where the vehicle and pilot are at risk.

Summary: Paragliders are generally low speed recreational aircraft and can't compete with other designs with regard to speed and distance and as the Skyrunner shows, they are not cheap. While there is no safety information on these types of vehicles, it would seem at best that they would not be any safer than other general aviation aircraft. The spinning propeller could also be a hazard to people outside the vehicle.
Electrostatic Propulsion

The I-Jet

$10,000 - $50,000
400 - 700
50,000
4,000 - 24,000
$0.0025 - $0.42
None
0 - 25
Completely Safe


Summary: The I-Jet's ion propulsion engine solves all of the problems that limit these mechanical devices.

1.
Range
There are three reasons for the extreme range of the I-Jet; A) thrust efficiency, moving more air for a given thrust, B) thrust efficiency increases linearly as thrust decreases, and C) the low drag of the I-Jet because of the elimination of all aerodynamic control surfaces due to the vectored and multi-axis thrust of the ion engines.


2.
Speed
There are three reasons for the high speeds of the I-Jet; A) thrust efficiency, moving more air for a given thrust, B) thrust can be increased by using higher power fuel cells, and C) the low drag of the I-Jet because of the elimination of all aerodynamic control surfaces due to the vectored and multi-axis thrust of the ion engines.


3.
Cost
The low cost of an I-Jet is due to its simplicity, a pod with a fuel cell and a few hundred parts vs the thousands in an automobile, and when it replaces the automobile as the dominant form of transportation, production quantities in the millions exceeding even that of the automobile today will further lower costs.


4.
Safety
The low temperature operation and no moving parts greatly enhances safety for both the I-Jet user and those on the ground. To create an independent redundant engine simply add additional electrodes next to the original electrodes and because the I-Jet has wings, horizontal landings can still be made using a small emergency battery for power. In addition, the I-Jet's dynamic stabilization, all weather flying capability, and collision avoidance sensors will eliminate all in flight hazards.


5.
Wildlife
The only way to protect wildlife is to move transportation off the ground and eliminate as much ground travel as possible. Only the I-Jet can make an appreciable dent in ground transportation because of its all weather flight capability.


6.
Pollution
If the fuel used is hydrogen that is generated from non CO2 sources, emissions will be zero. If other fuels are used, emissions will still be reduced up to a factor of ten per mile traveled due to the I-Jet's greater gas mileage.




As the table shows, there has been so much time, money, and, effort expended by all these extremely creative, talented, and dedicated people trying to make the dream of flight available to all. But the physics of current mechanical devices limits what can be done. These devices are the fourth generation of flying vehicles. The I-Jet is the fifth.So which would be your next vehicle if you could choose? Could the Automobile survive the I-Jet? Could any of the flying vehicles in the table above survive the I-Jet. We don't think so. How long it takes until you can purchase your own I-Jet is up to you.The FutureFlying cars are not the future and we certainly hope that self-driving cars will not be the future either. Flying cars are too expensive and very dangerous and self-driving cars solve none of the issues facing modern transportation except perhaps in time, some improvement in safety. But all the mechanical flying cars which for most people will never be afordable and all the self-driving cars stuck on the ground will never compete with the I-Jet. The I-Jet will be much cheaper to own and operate than any alternative and economics rules.If you have not watched our campaign video we suggest that you do so to see just what the fifth level of civilization will be like if and when atmospheric ion propulsion becomes the dominant form of transportation. If we are able to achieve 25% thermodynamic efficiency and our simulations indicate that we can, then all that is shown in the video will happen in the very near future.Why You Should DonateHow the I-Jet will Benefit YouAll that we have shown above should be reason enough for you to donate to this campaign. Nothing we can forsee in the area of transportation will benefit you and your family as much as the I-Jet will. Fly from your home coast to coast in six hours or New York to Paris in nine hours in complete safety at a cost under $50. The cost of shipping goods and material will be decreased by a factor of ten and these savings will be passed on to you the consumer. But the single most important reason for you to support us is the elimination of all transportation related deaths and injuries.Benefit WildlifeIf you care about wildlife and the environment, nothing you could support could begin to approach the benefits to wildlife that the I-Jet will provide by eliminating over a billion animal deaths a year worldwide and, as roads are phased out, greatly reducing habitat fragmentation.Eliminate PollutionIf you care about atmospheric pollution the I-Jet will eliminate all transportation related atmospheric pollutants including CO2. Also, it does not matter which side of the Climate Change debate you are on, the I-Jet really will be the only practical way to reach the targeted transportation related CO2 reductions because of the continued low cost of fossil fuels, all without costing the tens of trillions of dollars that current plans entail.Eliminate Poverty in the Third WorldIf you care about poverty in third world countries you should support us. Because the I-Jet requires no roads or other infrastructure except fueling stations, the I-Jet really is the only way to bring third world countries that cannot afford the massive cost of modern transportation into the modern world.Offer You New Thrills and AdventuresIf all these reasons are not enough then consider all the thrills and adventures you and your children can experience when in a few years you own an I-Jet.Further InformationWho we are.A brief history of Ion Propulsion.Introduction to Transportation Issues.Transportation Issues Part 1: Conventional SolutionsTransportation Issues Part 2: Proposed SolutionsTransportation Issues Part 3: The I-Jet

story:
Thank you for checking us out and this should be the biggest and greatest stunt ever preformed and you can be a part of history with us. This stunt will without question be viewed worldwide and watched by tens of millions. This stunt isn't about jumping a car, truck or motorcycle farther than anybody else, its not about setting a land speed record of any kind, its not about flying an airplane high, faster or farther than anybody else. Its not about base jumping higher or free falling father than anybody else. It is not about walking a tight wire higher or farther than anybody else. It simply is not about any stunt you have ever heard of, ever.

This stunt has zero room for error. What we will be doing is driving one of most advanced race cars on the planet………………..UPSIDE DOWN on the ceiling of a tunnel for 3 to 30 miles or more depending on tunnel length we find. 

How can this be done you ask? Open wheeled or winged race cars uses front and rear wings to give the car down force much like how an airplane wing lifts a plane into the air, on a car these wings are upside down therefore pushing the car onto the grown with as much as 3 to 4 times it weight. To do this the car must be doing 150 to 175 mph or more. We will be doing this upside down, in a tunnel at speeds of 150-175 mph for as long of a tunnel we can find to do the stunt in. We will have to build ramps to transition onto the wall and then rotate around to the ceiling accomplish our inverted drive and then transition down the wall, off the ramp of the other end of the tunnel at 150 to 175 mph with zero room for errors.

We have a list of potential tunnels to perform the stunt in worldwide, specialist on all levels of technical side of stunt, a car in mind and ideas how to build the ramps to transition onto the wall and then the ceiling of the tunnel. 

As you can see, this is something so amazing and unreal it has never been done before. Until now and with your help we can accomplish the thrilling stunt for the world to see setting a new worlds record at the same time. There is a huge amount of publicity associated with a worldwide viewed stunt like this and we will have some sponsorship positions available to the right companies visit our website for more information atwww.driveinverted.com now before we sell out. 

When my daughter was about 5 she was granted a wish from “Make A Wish” and what they did was absolutely amazing and that also has always stuck in my head. We are going to also use this stunt through television and sponsors to raise money for “Make A Wish” to give back to them so they can touch the lives of even more children. You pledge money is not for the charity, your pledge money is to help us do the stunt. We will again be using the stunt to raise money.

Help us, achieve a feat never attempted, help us set a world record never set, help us bring some positive into the world surrounded by so much negative and most importantly help us bring smiles to children’s faces in a time they need it the most. I please ask you help us spread the word, I am willing to do the stunt to help the kids, just help us raise the funds so we can do the stunt. We cannot do it without you please help us spread the word and accomplish the impossible.

We please ask you to help us spread the word, tell your friends, share on your social media, helps us bring some excitement back into the world in a time of so much unrest. We have a long list of great rewards and gifts for your help. Together with you and some hard work…………..we can turn the world upside down!

Risks and challenges

We have a great team ready to start at anytime. To accomplish the stunt we will need to find a race car and the exact tunnel location which could be located anywhere in the world. We have facilities for wind tunnel testing, car preparation, media and social events located. The only thing that may take time to secure will be the tunnel and any permits needed to accomplish the inverted drive. We estimate, we should be able to do the stunt within 6-12 months but as we are very excited to do as soon as possible.

What will your pledge be used for? We will be using your pledge money to purchase car, secure tunnel, TV production and other associated cost. We will have a title sponsor that will also help us with all cost associated with stunt.

story:
RydeSafe: Making the World Safer Since 2012

RydeSafe got its start in 2012 making reflective decals. Just one design in eight colors. Little stickers that apply to your bike and gear. They reflect light back to its source in order to maximize visibility to motorists sitting behind a pair of headlights.

In fact, they can make anything more visible at night. We’ve had customers use them on scuba fins, kayaks, climbing gear, mailboxes, hunting stands, and motorcycles!

We've shipped reflective decals all around the world, helping thousands of people safer at night.

Check out our website here:

https://rydesafe.com

Why Iron-On Reflectives?

Over the years we've received dozens of emails from satisfied customers asking questions like, "Can you apply these stickers to fabric?”

Until now, the answer was always no. You see, our reflective stickers could only be applied to smooth surfaces like a metal bike frame or a plastic helmet. Sure, they’d stick to a backpack or shirt for a while, but would eventually fall off and certainly wouldn’t make it through the wash.

Today we proudly introduce RydeSafe Iron-On Reflectives! A first-of-its-kind product to customize your commuter-wear and fabric gear with eye-catching reflectivity. 

How Do They Work?

The short answer: Science!  The slightly longer version is RydeSafe Iron-On Reflectives are cut from an engineering-grade “conspicuity film” which contains microscopic glass spheres that reflect light back to its source. 

So no matter what direction the light is coming from, the iron-on decals reflect it back. In the case of a pair of headlights, RydeSafe Reflective Decals reflect it right back to the driver’s eyes resulting in a more visible and thus safer user.

 

Why We Need the Funds

The funds we’re trying to raise will help cover expenses for a full production run. And if you help fund this campaign successfully, it’ll demonstrate that people want and need RydeSafe Iron-On Reflectives in their lives. This is invaluable validation because launching a new product takes a ton of time and money. We’ve already spent the time developing the product, but there’s more work to do and we want to make sure it’s a good idea before we move forward.
